item24.name: Sanag Earring Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth 5.3 with Microphone Open Ear Clip On Headphones with Charging Case Compatible with iPhone/Samsung Phone for Men,Women - White
item24.description:
Secure fit: The elastic clip earring design ensures a secure fit, making them suitable for various activities like running, cycling, and sports.
Stylish and Versatile: Available in different colors, this clip on headphones are designed to be fashionable for all, including men, women.
Safe and Comfortable: These headphones use air conduction technology that doesn't enter the ear and doesn't harm the ear after extended use. With a fully open design, you can enjoy your music while staying aware of your surroundings.
Long Battery Life: With an 800mAh battery compartment, these headphones provide up to seven hours of music playback on a single charge. The headphones can be charged three times using the battery compartment, ensuring uninterrupted listening.
Hassle-free Experience: The headphones come with a user manual and charging cable, and customer service is available to assist with any questions or concerns. you can be returned or exchanged unconditionally within one year of purchase.
reviews: These are the best ear buds ever! I waited a couple months to write review because I wanted to really put these buds to the test. These are my go to ear buds. I like them better than my Gallaxy buds! They are so comfortable and the battery life is amazing. I use theough entire workday without needing to charge. You can still hear everything going on around you, so these buds are amazing for work, if you need to be able to respond to others or the phone. Also, they won't fall off, even when running, bending, etc. Not for use in a super noisy area as they do not block hearing ambient sounds; however, the microphone does block background noise in calls. I am so happy that I purchased these buds! I use them daily.

I have gone through numerous earbuds over the years. Inevitably, they all lose sound out of one or the other. That could be because in getting tangled around me, I may pull the wiring from one bud loose eventually. Serious problem for me, as I am always listening to an audiobook. I’ve been wanting to get wireless, but I have always been afraid that they would fall out of my ears. I already have enough trouble with the earbud causing pain after a short period of time. I have small ear, canals, and the earbud, even with the smallest attachment, can be problematic.

Because I usually only have listened with one in, because I like to be aware of what’s going on around me, I had looked into the open air version. Almost all of them seem to hook over the outer ear, in a way that would completely interfere with my glasses.

I didn’t know what to expect from these. They look very strange, but I thought I’d give them a try. I am so very glad I did! They hook onto the ear very lightly but securely. I know they’re there, but they’re not heavy, and they don’t bother me . There’s nothing to go into the ear canal, so that is no longer a problem, no more pain. With the open ear, I can have both in, and still be able to hear what’s going on around me, which is a huge plus for me. The volume has been excellent. The only time that’s been a problem is when I’m on a very loud bus, with too much motor noise around me. That’s happened once out of all the times I’ve worn them.

The battery life seems excellent. Once they’re in the case, they no longer connect to the phone, so they are no longer connected to the Bluetooth for the playback. I need to make sure that I turn off play, before I take them out and pop them on, if I don’t wanna miss a word, lol. They do automatically connect as soon as they come out of the case. Once they’re in the case, they are also charging. You do need to be aware of the case having enough charge on it, and recharging that, because it can’t charge the earbuds if it’s not charged , lol. The controls seem fairly easy, but I have issues with dexterity and sensation in my fingers, so I still have to poke around to find the on-off, but that’s my own problem and I’m sure I’ll learn it eventually.

The only possible problem with these, if you are so, inclined, would be using them for phone calls. It’s been spotty, some people don’t complain, or simply say that it sounds like I’m in a tunnel. Others have said they can’t understand anything. That may be because they are the open air conduction rather than the bone conducting. I was not comfortable with the ones that do the bone conduction for the sound, and I don’t make enough phone calls that I need these for, overall. I’ve had some long conversations with people who have not had any trouble dealing with any “distortion“ in how well, my voice transmits.

Extremely happy with this purchase!

I hesitated with purchasing these because of the reviews saying that the sound quality was poor. The sound is fine. All you have to do is slide them down your ear and the sound will get higher. If the earpiece is up high on your ear, the sound is lower. The sound is not as good as my Samsung ear buds but they get the job done and saves my ears from hurting. I use earpieces to listen to audiobooks most of the time but I've received calls as well and haven't had any trouble hearing the caller. They fit my girly ears just fine and the battery life is OUTSTANDING. They last all day and I rarely put them back into the charging case until bedtime. I would definitely recommend these. They are comfortable and cool looking.

The good.
Sound quality is good, the fit is great, battery life is average about 4 hours.
The bad
Would connect randomly when not in use, would independently play different sounds.
One headphone would die and hour before the other.

Overall I would give these a 3. The ok ok for the price if you use the coupon, but need work

Maintain situational awareness, I use them in my classroom and when in the hospital. Makes it easy to still monitor my students as you can still easily hear them and easy to maintain awareness of what is going on especially in a hospital room so you are not surprised when a nurse or doctor walked in. I find them very comfortable (the design is great for those of us who where glasses as they do not loop over the ear) and good sound quality for what they are. Do not expect the high quality of a set of Shure earbuds, but the quality is good for what the are and the price you are paying for them. Remember to compare apples to apples (headphones of the same type and price range) there is no comparison to a pair of Shure Aonics but they are not in the same class, price range, or even type. But then again that is a comparison of apples to alligators. For what they are I love them, and use them frequently. Also they are comfortable and can be used individually, they also fit in the “wrong” ear comfortably. I prefer to have them only one in my right ear while I am teaching to keep in contact with colleagues.

I don't know this brand and its product, but based on previous reviews and product info I know, I gave a try and immediately notice the difference compared with other air earbuds. The main advantage is its unique egernomic design that won't put on weight on the ear top where usually that's prone to accumulate dirts, oils, and sweats. Secondly, it holds prety steadily but not pinchy so you won't feel it at all long time. I purchased this for my mom so she can wear at home all day enjoying the musics but never worry about missing phone calls or door bells. Third, the batteries of both earbuds and its host can last a few days without charging. I think as long as we are not really getting into the doomsday, battery is the least what you should concern. Bottom line, it does exactly what it's advertised, lgiht weight, no nonsense, easy to control, clear audio quality, free shipping and return, what more do I expect from 20$?! I don't understand why people complain its bass quality and noise isolation. It's like complaining Tesla can't take gasoline.

item25.name: PowerLocus Bluetooth Headphones for Kids, Wireless Foldable Headphones Over Ear, Headphone with Microphone, 85DB Volume Limit, Wireless and Wired Headset with Micro SD, FM for Cellphones, Tablets, PC
item25.description:
[Safe maximum volume of 85DB hearing protection] – PowerLocus over-ear headphones for kids will protect from hearing damage your children by placing a limit of maximum 85db maximum volume. This limit has been proven as a worldwide standard to be safe for the kids. Crystal clear audio with enriched bass that will allow the little audiophiles to enjoy their favorite tracks.
[Soft and Lightweight Design] – Travel friendly Foldable headphones for children coming together with carry case will fit easily in every backpack or suitcase. Equipped with super soft earmuffs and headband, their lightweight over the ear design will provide your kid with long lasting comfort. The ear cups will cover the ear completely in order to ensure the perfect sound isolation.
[Bluetooth 5.3, Aux enabled, FM radio and Micro SD] – With our bluetooth headphones over ear, your kids will have the freedom to easily switch between several modes. Our kids headphones are universally compatible and will instantly pair with iOS, Android, Windows, Mac etc. with huge wireless range up to 33ft/ 10m. Headphone that connects smoothly to Gaming Consoles like PS4,PS5, Xbox and Switch for both listening and speaking.
[Wireless headphones with microphone] – External and built-in microphones designed to improve the online learning experience for your children. Kids headphone with smooth hands-free mode is available on both wired and Bluetooth mode. On ear volume control, play/pause, voice assistant and accept/decline the incoming calls will ease their moments of joy.
[SUPPORT & 2 Years of WARRANTY] – Don’t worry if things get tough, you are covered with 2 Years of PowerLocus warranty. Surprise your loving ones with durable and elegant kids wireless headphones. If any issue happens, just reach out to us and we will help you.
reviews: Love these headphones. Had a different brand before that broke several times. These are durable and work well. Stay charged all day. Look cool and kid gets compliments on them.
We needed this for traveling overseas and this worked great for my toddler.

The value for money was worth it. It’s durable, kid and adult friendly and most importantly not too loud so I won’t worry about damaging my child’s hearing. The beautiful light pink was exactly like the photo shown. My daughter loves using it and I love not hearing 3 different shows. 😬😂

They’re as easy to use as any other set of headphones at this price point. They’ve lasted a year with our 4-year-old and they still work, so that’s something. I put them on once and realized the sound quality is garbage. My kid doesn’t know the difference. Ambivalent.

My granddaughter has had 3 pair of these. Her first set was used by her for 2+ School years and we just had to replace them. The ones she uses at home are the oldest and used most frequently and they are still going strong! I recommend these headphones!

Amazing product for toddlers. Easy to connect to any bluetooth device. The volume is great for kids because even at max volume they are no where near as loud as standard headphones. My daughter loves to just wear these around the house even when they are not connected to anything. Great product for parents tired of hearing let it go..let it go haha
We just unboxed it. And looks perfect. I love it came with a hard shell bag. It will help a lot when we travel. I will update how durable it is once we start using it.
Prácticos

These are the second pair I have purchased. First was a couple years ago for my oldest kid, who loves them, so I just go a pair for my youngest. They really are great headphones. The kids love them, super easy for them to use, turn on off and charge. The bluetooth connects flawlessly every time to their iPads. They find the very comfortable to wear, I dont have to ask them to put them on so I can hear their terrible shows. The pair from 2 years ago still work great and have great battery life still as well. Also for road trips super important to have. If the battery does go dead you can always plug the supplied Aux cable directly into the ipad and headphones and they work.

If you have any issues or questions their support is amazing as well. I originally was having charging issues but it turned out to be faulty cord I had laying around, not their product.

Highly recommend this product.

Wurde für die lange Fahrt in den Urlaub gekauft und wir sind super zufrieden damit !
Kinderleicht zu bedienen und auch die Soundqualität ist super.
Absolut empfehlenswert für lange Autofahrten für die Kids.!

Ottimo prodotto . Cuffie regolabili in lunghezza per adulti e bambini con volume max che non da fastidio . In comoda custodia che comprende cavo Jack e cavo usb per ricaricarle. Assente l'alimentatore ( potete usare un qualsiasi da telefono che abbia ingresso usb). Accendendole tramite pulsante le dovete cercare con bluethoot sul tablet-tv- smartphone che volete accoppiare . Questa operazione va fatta solo la prima volta poi va in automatico . Suono nitido senza interferenze sia per musica film giochi . Consiglio sicuramente l'acquisto.

Son unos auriculares súper bonitos pero además de buena calidad. Se escuchan perfectamente y son muy cómodos. La luz de las orejas va cambiando en tonos Neón pero no molesta al resto de personas que están en la misma habitación.Viene con una bolsa aterciopelada para guardarlos y el cable cargador. El envío fue rápido. Lo recomiendo.

item26.description:
【𝟐.𝟒𝐆𝐇𝐳 𝐃𝐈𝐆𝐈𝐓𝐀𝐋 𝐖𝐈𝐑𝐄𝐋𝐄𝐒𝐒 𝐓𝐄𝐂𝐇𝐍𝐎𝐋𝐎𝐆𝐘】DAYSNEW wireless TV headphones Featuring 2.4GHz millisecond response technology, which has faster connection speed and stronger anti-interference, 30M/98 ft working range is three times that of traditional Bluetooth headsets (33ft). Even if you enter another room, you can stay connected without static noise or automatic disconnection
【𝐏𝐋𝐔𝐆 𝐀𝐍𝐃 𝐏𝐋𝐀𝐘 & 𝐂𝐎𝐌𝐅𝐎𝐑𝐓𝐀𝐁𝐋𝐄】DAYSNEW wireless headphones for TV is no complicated pairing process. It provides the simple way to connect the transmitter dock to TV via the included cable (OPTICS/RCA/AUX), Just turn on the power and enjoy your TV show. And it features an ergonomic design, adjustable headband and soft earcups that won't get tired after long time to wear
【𝐇𝐈𝐆𝐇 𝐕𝐎𝐋𝐔𝐌𝐄 & 𝐏𝐄𝐑𝐒𝐎𝐍𝐀𝐋 𝐕𝐎𝐋𝐔𝐌𝐄】DAYSNEW TV headphones wireless for seniors Adopted with high resolution drivers and 2.4GHz ultra-low latency algorithms, which present a loud, clear sound and dialogue with less than 24ms audio latency. while the headphones have personal volume control to adapt to your hearing, and never worry about the high volume to disturb others

reviews: Simple setup, good sound quality, comfortable, reasonable price. Def recommend. They came in an order that arrived a day later than expected, which was not an issue for this item, I needed a different item quickly, but worked out fine for these headphones.
Great sound quality, easy to use , has a long distance range and perfect for the elderly.

Easy to connect. Good sound. Mute button would have been handy to turn off the commercials.
When they come on I take off the headset and give my ears a rest. So that my ears don't hurt I extend both sides, that works. No lip sync. My first charge was only 4hrs? Every subsequent charge has been on average 4-4 1/2hrs. I do not get 15-20 hours of use as advertised. I only get 10-11 hours max. That and no mute button is why I gave them 4 stars. The handbook does not tell you how to change the batteries but I figured it out if needed in the future and you cannot contact the manufacturer in China! Here's hoping they last at $80 as it seems that so many of these headphones either break or do not last that long.
Installation not easy if you are not familiar with this kind of tech device.

The good news - it works and sounds good once all connected properly. The bad news - the directions are confusing. The TV sound has to manually be changed from normal sound to optical sound; I had a Cowin before and it did it automatically. The red transmitter power light only comes on when I switch the TV sound source (they do sort of tell you this). I don't like having to retract the headband every time I need to recharge the headphones. "connect the equipment to a different circuit than the TV"; electricity is electricity this makes no sense and the unit still worked when connected to the same circuit. It took over an hour to figure everything out. It should be a 5 minute job. A longer (6 foot) optical cable would have been useful.
Love this product, loved the voice quality. Will Recommend to my friends.

followed set up instructions.....tried each method....never got sound thru the headphones... : ( I will be returning them to Amazon

And.... NO phone number for technical support !!!! Made in China, need I say more !

i bought a 15 dollar pair that would cut out, or pick up radio station. they went through batteries very fast. this one is rechargeable , and they stay on tv station really well. should have spent more the first time.

item29.name: PHILIPS A4216 Wireless Sports Headphones, up to 35 Hours Play time, Washable Cooling Ear-Cup Cushions, IP55 Water/dust Protection, Bluetooth + 3.5 mm Audio Port, Built-in Microphone TAA4216BK
item29.description:
BOOST YOUR DAY: With up to 35 hours play time, these wireless on-ear headphones are with you while you train-and beyond. A full charge takes 2 hours, and a 15-minute boost gives you extra 2 hours of use.
ALWAYS FEEL FRESH: Tough, lightweight and durable. Soft, breathable ear-cup cushion sleeves are detachable for easy cleaning and are filled with cooling gel for those extended workout sessions.
NOTHING CAN STOP YOU: These headphones have undergone rigorous testing, just like you. An IP55 rating means they are as happy on dusty trails as they are in heavy rain.
PUMP UP YOUR TUNES: Perfectly tuned 40 mm neodymium drivers deliver energizing bass.The closed-back design allows you to keep your music to yourself, whether you’re hitting the treadmill or the beach.
FOR SPORTS OR ON THE GO: These Go series headphones are engineered to keep you going. The multi-function button lets you pause your playlist, take calls, control volume, and call upon your phone's voice assistant.
INSTANT BLUETOOTH PAIRING: Bluetooth 5.0 allows you to connect to your smartphone seamlessly, wherever you are. If you’re running low on battery, you can switch to wired connection via the 3.5 mm audio port for non-stop workout.
EASY STORAGE: The sleek design looks great whether you're going for your personal best or having fun on a weekend break. Inward-folding ear cups make storage easy.
ACCESSORIES INCLUDED: USB-C cable and quick start guide.
reviews:
First off, it's important to note that these headphones fill a niche: somebody who wants an over-ear style closed-back headset that has some degree of water/dust resistance (in this case, IP55). They probably shouldn't be the only pair of headphones you own and use. These are ideal for exercise (since they can handle sweat) or anywhere they might get hit with drops of rain or sand. You can even use them in the bathtub without worry of splashing on them (unlike most other over-ear sets), but be very careful not to submerge or drop them in the water.

If you don't need the water resistance, you can find better audio quality and comfort. For home listening, I'd suggest springing a bit more for a comfortable open-back headset set, and for casual listening outside the house, high quality earbuds (which I'd also suggest springing a bit more for) are still ideal. However, my problem with earbuds is that when exercising, my ear canals tend to tighten up and they become extremely uncomfortable. This set is built to stay on your head while exercising, so it can feel a bit tight after a couple hours, but the earpads have a soft "cooling gel" that is better than other sets I've used, and it definitely gets more comfortable after a short break-in period. As an added bonus, the pads are removable and the outer lining is washable (although they feel pretty durable, I'm curious to see how long they last). The headband has a strip of rubber to soften the pressure, but it does feel a bit too hard and some comfort improvements could be made there. On the other hand, it feels built like a tank - they're light on your head, but still feel extremely durable. Other bonuses include a standard audio jack as an option instead of Bluetooth, big sturdy volume control buttons that aren't a pain to use like most headset controls, and an insane battery that lasts ages (I got at least the manufacturer spec of 35 hours, using them 2-3 hours a day for nearly two weeks without needing to recharge).

These weren't the first pair of water-resistant cans I bought from Phillips. The previous version was the SH402, which I bought based on goodwill coming from their excellent X2 headphones I've used for years. These were an absolute travesty, with buzzing out of one side and audio quality that sounded like somebody playing music under a couch in the next room with the door closed, and I'd never returned something so fast. The A4216 set VASTLY improves on these, with very good audio quality. It's still not top-tier in the pure audio department or anything - it's a bit overly bassy with a hint of a muffled quality in the way a lot of closed-back headsets that are built to prevent audio leakage are - but it's more than good enough as a minor compromise to balance out the other benefits this set has (especially for the reasonable price), and again, if you don't need an exercise/water-resistant headset, you'd probably want to look elsewhere anyway. If you happen to be in that particular market though, I'm not sure you can really do much better than these.

I want to start by saying that the audio quality on these is exactly what you'd expect from headphones under $100. The lows are a little muddled and the bass is lacking, but other than that they have generally decent audio quality. I'm able to listen to all of my favorite songs without feeling like anything is seriously lacking, but I definitely won't use these for any studio work.

That said: holy crap I don't think these are capable of running out of battery. I've been using them at the gym 5 days a week for about an 1.5 hours and they just... don't die? They advertise 30 hour battery life but I'm at about 2 months of continuous use and I JUST plugged them in for the first time. Not even because they died, but because I had the reasonable human impulse to plug them in after 2 months of not doing so. I'm not sure if these headphones have the capability to harness power from the sun or from God herself or what.

I would normally give headphone like these about a 3 or so out of 5, but the battery life alone adds another star. Not to mention the price being so low... These headphones are honestly great. I still prefer my AT ATH-M50xBTGM wireless headphones when I'm at home because the quality is superior (they were also $200, to be fair) but this particular pair of philips headphones comes with me everywhere I go simply for the sheer utility of them. It's almost a 100% guarantee that they will have enough charge for whatever I'm doing that day.

Based on the price point, battery life and overall quality, these get a 4.5 from me. Rounding to a 5 because Amazon.

I have had these for about a week. I was looking for a headset I could use for home office with audio, but could also be used for walks outdoors. I ordered one prior to this and they made my ears sweat, and were not so comfortable due to how large and plasticy feel the ear cushion was despite it's decent reviews, but they KEPT disconnecting from my lap top off and on mid calls, which was a FAIL... so I returned them and then ordered these.
PROS:
They are very sturdy, don't feel cheap at all.
The sound quality (my oppinion) is GREAT - deep base, but sound is clear, and decent, loud enough.
Fit snug I suppose if you will workout, run, they should stay put.
The ear peice is like a soft mesh which I like better than some fake leather/rubber type ones that make your ear sweat.
They have NOT disconnected ONCE from my laptop and I use them all day.
Cons:
They are a bit tight, which is good I guess if you will run/jog...but I think moving forward I will get ON ear vs over the ear, because they put pressure (not ALOT) enough where I just don't LOVE it.
While the sound QUALITY is very good, they don't get very loud, but it's like the perfect amount, not too loud not too soft I suppose. I HAVE Not hooked them to my phone yet so they might be different there.
There is a little rubber peice that covers the charge hole, my last set just had a slot, I am quite sure this will break off eventually.
I have not tried to see if I can connect to 2 things - phone and computer, like go between the 2.
I think won't I really don't like is the HEAD cusion - quite frankly it sucks. It is not even a cushion, more of a semi soft extra layer of rubber. My last set (Sol Republic) were SOOOOO soft at the top like a pillow of cussion and the PERFECT ear fit, not too much not too little and super soft I barely noticed them HOWEVER they were not a tight fit and would move sometimes when running - why didn't I get their latest model? they were like $160 but I probably will next time. It last me like 4 years! LOL :)
- and final con, is lately people are like what? I cannot really hear you - but the volume is on full volume..that doesn't happen each call..so we shall see.
IF you just want for SALES or home office, maybe a headset for that is better suited. BUT I wanted to be able to use it for that AND outdoors, so I opted for this. :)
Hope that helps.

A mí esposa le encantaron, me dijo que la batería le dura bastante, le gustan porque puede hacer ejercicio con ellos sin riesgo a qué se deterioren por el sudor o la humedad
y está encantada con el sonido de los mismos 👍🏼.
Noise cancellation is okay and total output is also ok. Not the greatest.
Son buenos, sin embargo jn poco pesados y poco ergonómicos.

item31.name: Soundcore Anker Life Q20 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones, Wireless Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones with 40H Playtime, Hi-Res Audio, Deep Bass, Memory Foam Ear Cups and Headband (Renewed)
item31.description:
Incredible Sound Loved by 20 Million+ People
Hi-Res Audio -Custom oversized 40 mm dynamic drivers produce Hi-Res sound. Life Q20 active noise canceling headphones reproduce music with extended high frequencies that reach up to 40 kHz for extraordinary clarity and detail.
Reduce Ambient Noises By Up to 90% -Our team of engineers conducted more than 100,000 tests in real-life scenarios to fine-tune Life Q20’s 4 built-in ANC microphones and digital active noise cancellation algorithm. As a result, the hybrid active noise cancellation can detect and cancel out a wider range of low and mid-frequency noises such as cars and airplane engines.
100% Stronger Bass -Our exclusive BassUp technology conducts real-time analysis of the low frequencies to instantly strengthen the bass output. Double press the play button when listening to bass-heavy genres like EDM and hip-hop for an amplified listening experience.
reviews: Good quality for a even better price! There’s plenty reasons why these headphones are still on everyone list for “most bang for your buck”. These and their little brother,the Soundcore Q20+, are some of the best value in headphones. Between durability,sound quality, ANC,fit and portability they are a solid buy everytime and a good introduction to entry level ANC headphones. Battery life incredible too

I love these headphones, they last a super long time, come with a nice travel bag, and cover the ears without sitting on them. Noise cancelling is so good it annoys my boyfriend because I can’t hear him when he tries talks to me 😂 I kind of wish they folded up nicer (they’re still a little bulky if trying to pack them in a bag) but overall really nice headphones and the price is amazing for the quality.

These are pretty decent headphones for the price ($35). Comfortable too. Noise Cancelling is OK. I don’t know much about NC, but the best way to describe it is you can still hear a loud door knock, just not the echoes following it. Highly recommend if you only use Bluetooth mode. AUX mode is where its weakness lies. Particularly AUX with NC turned on.

AUX wired mode is noticeably lower quality than Bluetooth wireless mode, but still ok quality for watching movies (though sub-average for music). HOWEVER, the biggest con which ultimately made me return these is when turning on noise cancelling while in AUX mode (necessary on planes) — there is a continuous static noise that accompanies whatever your watching/listening to unless you drown it out with high volume. However, even when drowned out, I feel the static noise still makes my ears/head ache after prolonged use. Since I got these mainly for using on the plane (AUX+NC MODE) and they do not work well in that mode, I will be returning them. Such a shame. Almost perfect for my needs.

i could rave about these for HOURS - i love these so much i bought a pair for me & my eldest daughter (19)

noise cancellation - the nosie cancellation is perfect, you can tell the distinct difference between it being on & off, & even when off the sound is still sealed off to fit your ear & give you the best sound experience.

ganingn & streaming - this headset is so well my daughter replaced her razer pink kitty headset with these for better gaming audio, better streaming audio, & for better music - perfect for streamers !

battery life - you could leave these on for a few hours using them or not, & they would still be full battery. we forget to charge them all the time whether we’re using them constantly or if we just put them off to the side for a few days to even a few weeks, they manage to hold an AMAZING charge. i don’t think i’ve ever had them actually die on me, most it’s gone to is medium battery !! theyere battery preserving !

music - gives out the best bass, no need to have them to loud in case it give you a headache, but is perfect for mellow music, loud music, & asmr. feels very immersive, & even does the effect of being able to only hear out of one headset & the other - super cool !

gaming - can hear smaller detailings (ex: knocking in a horror game) & really sucks you into the game truly, feels like it has its own surround sound

comfort - if your sensitive to things squishing your head or easily prone to headaches, i would recommend only wearing these for shorter periods of times. my daughter wears it on her long walks (typically 1-4 hours a day) & comes back with headaches from having them on to long. as well as fitted glasses, be weary because they will squish your glasses in your head a bit, & cause headaches. besides that, they’re very comfortable on the ears with the padding, & the band tracts & retracts to fit your head shape & comfort !

look - sleek & beautiful, fits a good aesthetic if you want an alternative to the expensive sony or gaming headphones. would look cute with add on cat ears or others accessories as such, or stickers ! even blank they look very aesthetically pleasing

overall, these headphones i love, & my daughter can attest that she never leaves the house without them, & her person.

perfect for anyone who wants to concentrate, listen to music in a tasteful way, read, game, write, & feel concentrated & immersed into it, perfect for trips or walks - the possibilities are endless !!

Bought these for the gym as I wanted over the ear headphones but didn’t want to break the bank on some that are going to get sweaty all the time. Sound quality is a crisp 7.5/10 and the bass is pretty decent, a cool feature is that you are able to turn on/off the noise canceling option with a physical button on the headphones, cushioning on it feels great and is easily cleanable with disinfecting wipes or such. Battery life is great on them as well I go 3 days with one charge typically 2-2 1/2 hrs a day. I also did try them for gaming when I first got them and they were great in game, I was able to hear footsteps all around with no problems you can use the Bluetooth option but there is a wire included which I suggest you use, the mic also sound pretty decent at my score of an 7/10 but for the price I think these are definitely worth it as I’ve bought myself another pair as backup and also have gotten some for my niece and she loves them.

Fantastic sound and airplane and ambient noise canceling. Charge lasts very long time. Refurbished version now ships with more common USB micro charging socket, not USB mini socket. Easy control system.
For the amount of money it cost this product is amazing. Sound quality and comfort are are above my expectations!! I will buy again as a gift
First use was in a Southwest airplane, very noticeable when I put them on, when I lifted them off during the flight I couldn't believe how loud the noise became.

I bought these for use as part of an assisted listening system at our church. The room is fairly live, and the HVAC system is quite loud, so lots of reverb and white noise most of the time. The quality of construction on these is actually quite impressive for the price. The headphones are very comfortable for the 2 or so hours they are used each week, and the controls are easy to use. The sound quality is actually very good (especially for our intended use). As a musician and sound tech, I value clarity and a balanced frequency response, and these perform very well.

What surprised me the most was the quality of the Active Noise Cancellation (ANC). They compare really well with my Bose Q35's, which are about 5x the price. The white noise of the HVAC and bad reverb of our room are completely cancelled out, which I didn't expect to happen with a sub-$100 headphone.

If you are a snobby audiophile who demands the most accurate sound possible, you are likely going to spend 10x as much on headphones that can only give marginally better performance than these do. If you are someone who wants to enjoy good quality sound with excellent ANC at a really good price, I highly recommend these headphones.

I got these so I could watch programmes on my laptop without disturbing other family members, and they have become one of my favourite possessions very quickly! They are incredible. They block the sound to others, and at the same time your own sound is rich and immersive. The charge lasts a very long time too so you don’t have to worry about it on long trips.
I love them! Good value too for such a quality product.
könnten etwas lauter sein aber ansonsten für den preis wirklich perfekt
Sounds great. Second pair, can’t beat quality for price. Anker proving to be a solid reliable brand.

Diese On-Ear Kopfhörer von Anker sind super im Klang und ihrer Qualität. Sie sitzen fest am Kopf ohne zu verrutschen. Also auch perfekt für ein ordentliches Workout. Der Sound ist einfach super. So wie ich es von Anker kenne.
Klare Kaufempfehlung von mir.

reviews:
Wow!! Just received today. Don't know where to start. These are truly fantastic in every regard! I listen to all kinds of music and have owned expensive stereo systems in my car and home. This review concerns using the HA-RX500's listening to music through my PC. I am very particular about quality. I want to hear all the details in a piece of recorded music and want background parts at the right sound level in relation to the other instruments/vocals in a song. These headphones have AMAZING sound--not for $20--just amazing sound in their own right. I read a review that said they have better sound quality than a $120 pair of headphones, and I couldn't agree more. Sound is rich and full. Can hear all layers of all types of music. Bass is very impressive as are the highs, but what truly impressed me, and which I have found lacking in two other sets of headphones I recently ordered, is the quality of the mid-range sounds.

The headphones are incredibly light-feeling on your head and the ear pads are soft and very, very comfortable. The long cord is absolutely no problem and looks and feels substantive, unlike some other cheap, very thin cords. They are excellent at outside sound dampening. I researched so many headphones for hours and bought a pair of JVC HAV-570 "Super Bass" headphones. Admittedly, they were only $13, but they had many of the same specs as the X500's, i.e., 40mm drivers, etc, but the sound on the X500'S is literally five times better, and this saying a lot, because I was mildly satisfied with the cheaper pair (which got four stars overall on Amazon). However, wanting more, I purchased a pair of Audio-Technica ATH-M30 Professional Headphones through Amazon for $40. They lacked range and were tight and felt smothering when worn. They don't come close to the JVC X500 in sound quality. I returned them and was going to settle for the other JVC's until I saw these on Amazon).

I am not an expert at describing what makes for high sound quality but I know that when someone says, when describing headphones, that they hear parts of songs they couldn't previously hear well with other headphones, that means something, if accurate. That description is absolutely true with these headphones. It's not so much you will hear sounds that you never heard at all, it is that you will hear instrumental parts and vocals (such as some back up vocals), much clearer and stronger than you hear them with other headphones. I must re-emphasize that the sound from these headphones is incredibly rich and full, especially if your system has a graphic equalizer that you can admust to your particular likes. You cannot go wrong with these headphones!! I am almost in disbelief that they cost only $18, seem solidly made, are extremely comfortable and the sound will impress you to no end. They are heaven!

I run a podcast and I was searching for an affordable solution that provided three key factors: Comfort, Clarity, and Compactness. The comfort factor was the most important because if you are going to have a few of your guests wearing these for an hour, they need to feel like nothing is there. Clarity for the quality of the sound and to make sure your guests hear themselves clearly. Compactness for a podcast that has to go to multiple places.

I tested these JVC HARX500 against the following: JVC HARX330, Monoprice Premium Hi-Fi Dj Style,
Vogek On Ear Headphones with Mic, Tascam TH-02, Koss UR20, and Panasonic RP-HT161-K.

Here is how they stacked up:
JVC HARX330: decent clarity and lower profile for over the ear headphones but they really hurt my ears because they didn't completely cover my ears
Monoprice Premium Hi-Fi Dj Style: If this purchase was for just listening to music or doing something other than my needs, this would have been my choice. The set was comfortable, albeit a bit on the heavy side and the clarity was unsurpassed. By far the best of all. However, these headphones had a good seal around my ears and I was unable to hear ambient noise. As a podcaster, I need to be aware of A/C units running in the background and I was unable to hear mine when wearing this. For my purposes, I need to be able to hear things that the microphone may or may not pick up.
Vogek On Ear Headphones with Mic: I tried these just to see if on-ear headphones would work. Not for the comfort factor. However, these won the compact prize. They could fold up to the size of my palm which was a bonus.
Tascam TH-02: with all the great reviews, I thought this was going to be a winner. However, it was very bulky and didn't fit on my head properly. Good quality sound but still not great. So it didn't win the prize for comfort because of its weight. These however did fold so they could have gotten a bonus point for compactness.
Koss UR20: These things were a beast. This means it didn't pass the compact test. However, the sound clarity was terrible. I was amazed at how distorted voices were. It sounded like every time I talked I could hear myself clipping and I didn't hear that with any other headphone.
Panasonic RP-HT161-K: Decent slimmer profile but didn't pass the comfort test.

The JVC HARX500 met 2 of the 3 conditions I felt were the most important, comfort and clarity. After putting on these headphones, I just felt like I could easily have them on for hours without any worry of fatigue or my ears hurting. The sound coming from the speakers was true to self and was great for the price point. As mentioned above, it still allows some ambient noise to penetrate so you can hear background noise and isn't completely noise isolation which I needed. These fail the compact use case but they are still slimmer in profile compared to the Monoprice and Koss ones. I can overlook that for the top 2 needs

reviews: I am using this headset every day last 6 months . No issues sound quality and noice cansellation is really good..most amazing thing is it’s battery life I charge it only once in a week or once in 10 days…. And the hard shell case also is with a good quality metrical… it really worth the price. Compete with all premium headphones.

I bought these as a replacement for an Mpow bluetooth headset from a few years ago. These are great for the price, though the ear pads are a little small. The plastic arms look a little fragile and I can see them cracking easily if you're not careful.

Battery life is really good. After a week of use they are still at full charge.

The mic sounds odd on phone calls and has a lot of echo. I'm not sure yet how to fix it.

The sound quality is ok, but the bass level is a little too high compared to all the other sets I've owned.

Overall these are good for the price, but I'd rather buy the Mpow again (if they were available).
Dislike Notting love it
Very comfortable and battery lasts forever. I use the app to switch back and forth between my phone and my computer audio- can have two Bluetooth channels connected at a time. These work great!

Awesome headphones!
I bought these as a secondary pair of headphones I can wear around the house. The build is lightweight due to the plastic, but the sound is great for the price! Best aspect is the battery life. I've had these for about a month and a half, and I charged these a total of 3 times. I use these headphones for at least 2-3 hours daily.
Just wanted to let you know, these are NOT noise canceling headphones. Noise canceling is not a designated feature unfortunately! But rather, it is how the headphones fit over your ears, which will naturally cancel out some noise.
Overall, these are an easy 5/5.

I ordered this mostly for the headphones, but it’s worth mentioning that I received a case that doesn’t even fit the headphones in it. So am I gonna return the whole item just because of the case? No, of course not, I need to replace my Raycons. (Which are really bad btw, don’t buy Raycon.)

Anyway, the headphones are great for what I need. Noise cancelling isn’t really present, but I often need to know when people are trying to get my attention at work. Audio quality is significantly better on these than the pair they’re replacing, and they’re half the price. Pairing is easy and the voice isn’t obnoxious. Battery life seems incredible. Went from charging my old pair nightly; I’ve had this pair for four days and they’re only at 70%.

Go buy a listing with no case so you don’t get swindled, these are pretty good
I’ve had these for over a month and have only charged them once! I use them at least 5x a week too at the gym. They’re on the smaller size as compared to some bulky headphones. I love them.
They are great quality, my last pair lasted 3.5 years but I used them every day and worked out in them 5 times a week. I just bought a new pair and they’re still great, highly recommended

reviews:
This headset is very nice for an over-the-head type headphones.
It does last long on a single charge. You can get hours of playback time on a single charge.
It is portable and comfortable around the ears. it is easy to pair to your phone or alternative devices.
Recommend for anyone who needs a good headset on the go, but is on a budget.

I have several pairs of headphones all wireless but different versions for different occasions. Example these I wear when I take public transportation and I want it to be known I am wearing headphones and also that I don't want to be bothered. I will say when it coems to volume these do seem a little low in volume in comparison to others I have when I am wearing them over say a winter hat but alone they function just perfectly. Even when I wear them with winter hats though the volume is loud enough but it's not drowning if that makes sense its enough to keep you entertained but not completely distracted.

These have no Active Noise Cancelation or Transparency Mode.

You can get really nice headphones of this type with ANC & TM for $20-40 (Falebare, Rulolim, etc.).

PROs:

- Very inexpensive when selling for under $15

OKs:

- Sound quality is fine in Mid and High range. Bass is muddy, not clear.
- Oval earmuffs are standard size...large enough for most ears.
- Foldable, lightweight

CONs:

- No Active Noise Cancelation or Transparency Mode
- No brand or model markings on the headphones
- No stated warranty
- The 3 buttons are hard to identify by touch
- Hollowed-out center of each earmuff is shallower than others (about 1/2" deep vs 5/8" or 3/4"). Could be uncomfortable (depending on your ears) if worn for a few hours.

NIT PICKs:

- No markings for Left, Right
- English parts of the User Guide are in very tiny font.

I was quite disappointed to see these brand new headphones had arrived damaged with scuff marks. Did I receive a used item?

They are very lightweight and made with thin, cheap plastic. I wouldn't recommend jogging with these on due to risk of easy internal and external damage if they fall on the ground.

The sound quality is good but the bass could be better. They are not noise cancelling headphones but, for the price, I guess they will do.

I have not yet used the headphones during a phone call. So I cannot speak on the sound and microphone quality. I will come back and update on that.

Also, the operating guide requires a magnifying glass as the print is super tiny.

Overall, outside of the damage, these headphones are good for casual, sedentary use.

My Headphones arrived a little scuffed and I couldn't get it to buff out which is okay but not ideal. They are just as described and have good Bluetooth range and functionality. They are very comfortable and well cushioned on the ears and headband. The sound quality is great for calls and meetings and a little tin-y lacking bass and a well rounded sound for music listening. They do well at blocking out other noise and would be great for work or school!
I got these for my workouts. They fit well. The sound quality is good. Easy Bluetooth connection. I also like that they fold for easy packing/travel. Recommend for the price point.

I prefer these over ear headphones to my in ear model because they stay on during my workouts. The sound quality is definitely adequate for my use. They hold their charge for a long time before you have to recharge and I like that. They fold for storage. They are my new go-to headphones when I exercise or walk.
I love how loud these headphones are. They fit perfectly on my head and stay during workouts. Easy Bluetooth connection.

reviews: I've only had these a month and don't use them consistently but am impressed with the comfort - secure but not squeexing my head. And the sound is mellow with soft jazz - haven't tried them on Rock (& probably never will!) but they do have a good balance. Again, with not using them regularly, I can't speak to battery life real well, but just having them lay around & using them occasionally, the battery held up real well, and the charge time doesn't seem to be too long. Noise is not completely blocked out but, for me, that's OK - I can still be aware of what's around me, just well muffled. I would definitely recommend them.

So far so good but I’ve only had them a day. I’m wearing them now listening to soft classical at a moderate level - this is important. I have the “noise canceling” feature turned on and I can still hear the news from my iPad sitting a few feet away. If it were true noise canceling, I shouldn’t be able to hear a baby screaming in my arms.
Not truly noise canceling but it does cut out a lot of background clutter if you’re truly trying to focus or tune something out.

The sound is good, they were easy to charge though it did take longer than I would have wanted. They fit my head well and cover my ears completely.

I have had a pair for a couple months, and they had the most desirable qualities among affordable Bluetooth headsets. I had just ordered a second pair for work, and before it arrived I accidentally discovered that these headphones actually have multipoint capabilities. That is, I have them connected to both my work laptop for zoom calls and my phone for music at the same time. There's no switching between devices. When you start paying sounds on one, it overrides the other and vice versa. I have excessively large ears and head, and this headset fits my ears and doesn't press on my temples. The sound quality is great in my opinion, but I'm also not an audiophile. The noise cancellation isn't perfect, but it's great for the price point. The only real downside is that the mic didn't swing out, and the mic quality is not great. Other people can hear me, but it sounds like I'm on speakerphone.
Pretty high quality. Bass is great. I wish they got a little louder, but that’s probably a safety feature so you don’t damage your hearing

I am just an average user and don't expect much for a pair of headphones at this price point, but I was happy with them after I first got them. The sound at the lowest volume setting is louder than I like but I can live with it. Noise cancelling works pretty well for the price. Battery life served my needs, and didn't notice any change in battery power over time. I have a small head, and the headband is a little bit long for me.

The plastic bracket for the left earpiece broke off after less than 1 year of heavy but careful use. I suppose this is expected for headphones of this design, but I wish they weren't as disposable as the ones I grew up with. I added on a warranty just so I could get a refund without a lot of hassle. It is unfortunate that it broke structurally, because otherwise I would have been content to keep using them.
It works great. Easy pairing and connection. The quality of the sound is great too. But it doesn't have an excellent noise canceling.

I like these headphones a lot. They're very cute, comfortable, and have decent sound quality for the price. I don't think they noise cancel more than other headphones but are definitely a huge step up from earbuds. I haven't had them die on me and have used them for many hours at a time.

My issues with them are that sometimes the Bluetooth cuts out and I have to turn them off and back on to reset them. Also, my phone (iPhone 11) didn't originally go straight to Bluetooth, and when I manually set it, I've been told that the microphone quality isn't good (muffled, difficult to understand).

I think these are a great pick for the price and useful as a university student.

The noise cancellation function is excellent. It is good quality, simple to operate, and easy to carry. Using these headphones for listening to music makes me very happy; the headphones are very light, and wearing them for a few hours doesn't make me feel any uncomfortable. I can enjoy my music time and feel really good. Whenever my mood is low, I will wear it to listen to music for a while. I like this product a lot, and I will recommend it to my friends who also love to listen to music. The price is very affordable and reasonable; I recommend you guys buy it!!
I use these for a noisy office environment. They are lightweight and comfortable. They don't eliminate all the noise, but definitely make it easier to concentrate on my work!
First pair didn’t work, easy return and ordered a new pair! Second pair work like a dream, crazy comfortable for my giant head and so pretty! Definitely would order again

Not really house counseling.
The sound is great, volume is loud😅😁
Love the pink colour.
Very comfortable.

Sound quality is good for the money you paid. Love this because foldable & lay flat. Good for the trip use.
Not yet have chance to test the noise cancellation on the flight.
They are not as noise reducing as the description said. Disappointing.

Foldable and Portable Sound Cancelling Headphones: Bluetooth headphones over ear weigh 0.41l pound. You can fold headphones into a smaller volume and then put them in a travel bag to take with you wherever you go.
Bluetooth Microphone:Noise cancelling bluetooth headphones can be connected to different electronic devices. Wireless over the ear headphones built-in microphone allows for hands-free, clear phone communication.
Comfortable Ear Muffs: Noise cancelling headphone are designed for long-term comfort. Soft and comfortable protein ear cushions with improved air permeability and a unique ergonomic fit provide a tight fit in the ears for better sound and full sound immersion.Ulacici bluetooth wireless headphones are ideal for adults, teenagers at home, office, school, travel and sports.

item38.name: bmani Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth Headphones 48hrs Play Back Sport Earphones with LED Display Over-Ear Buds with Earhooks Built-in Mic Headset for Workout Sky Blue
item38.description:
Dual LED Displays Charging Case: Wireless earbuds with LED display make it obvious to show the battery power of the case and ear buds. The remaining power in percentage on the screen is shown to the left of the bluetooth headphones. The right side is assigning to a charging process of each bud, there are separated power consumption indicators by 4 grids in total, each grid represents 25% power of bud. During Charging, the LED indicator light will flash.
Bluetooth and Stereo Sound Quality: bluetooth earbuds adopt bluetooth technology, which can offer a clear and smooth connection, allowing you to hear crystal clear calls like you are communicating face to face with others. Don't worry about interruptions on listing to music and calling.
One Button Control and Auto Pairing: Compared with touch control, button control is easy so that you can obviate any operations and don't need to remember its instruction. When you pick wireless earphones out of the charging case, they'll automatically connect to the paired previous device. The range can reach up to 33ft away. When you put it back, the bluetooth earphones shut down and are recharging.
Designed for Sports: Sport headphones to keep you motivated, a secure fit that won’t shift or fall out during long hours of training, and no wires to hold you back. Equipped with 3 pairs of ear caps and flexible earhooks, which can stay on your ears and get a suitable fitting. So that you will not feel tired and pain when wearing it for a long time. bluetooth earphones can fit for camping, running, or working out, even on a rainy day.
reviews:
I’ve been looking for some better earbuds than the Jabra Elite Active 65t’s I’ve been using the last couple years. The T16’s from Bmani are a huge improvement, and here is why:

1: Bass! My main reason for wanting a different ear Bud was the Jabras had zero bass. Harder music was sadly reproduced.

2: Clarity. I listened to these today for the first time, and I heard several song lyrics I had never heard before. It was really wild to understand something I had missed hundreds of times before.

3: Fit. My Jabra’s stayed in pretty good, even when onewheeling off-road in bumpy conditions. However, the Bmani set feels like I could do backflips and they’d stay put. Comfortably, I might add!

4: These can be used with one earbud or both! This is a game changer. I can now have one in and listen to music but still hear my wife talking to me. (The music would stop if I put one of them in the case with the Jabra unit.) Two people could even share, I suppose!

5: As a result of the single earbud mode, each earbud has independent volume and multifunction buttons. Very intuitively designed! In fact, I put the earbuds in before looking closely at them, and I was able to turn up the volume up just assuming the buttons were what they are. You can tell the designers of these also used them.

6: The charging case! Ok, the case feels like cheap plastic. But, it is super functional! It even shows the power level of each earbud!

In short, these are fantastic earbuds for $75, but they’re way cheaper than that.

I got these to use at the gym and they work fine.

The battery life is pretty good, I've never had them die on me as far as I can remember.

They're pretty comfortable - I can't do ear buds, they just don't stay in my ear, but the loops on these actually make them stay relatively well.

The case is nice and compact, charges quickly and shows you the battery life inside it.

The controls on the side are easy to use, I feel sometimes those buttons don't work well but these are good.

The noise cancellation is questionable, it's maybe a liiiittle better than normal earbuds but if you didn't tell me they had the feature, I probably wouldn't have noticed.

The audio quality isn't great, about as good the default apple earpods, but I didn't get them for that.

My only real issue ive run into is that after about 4-5 months of having them, the case has stopped closing all the way and so one of them doesn't fully connect to the case. This means that it doesn't charge consistently, and worse - my phone will randomly connect to them when they're in my bag, sometimes even connect to them in the car, switching off my car Bluetooth which is annoying as hell.
I fixed this issue by folding a half of a tissue and putting it in the case and putting a hair tie around it. This keeps the earbud in place and works fine. Obviously not ideal but it's not the absolute end of the world. And for the price I feel like I got my money's worth pretty well.

I almost bought a really expensive pair, but honestly these work fine, for both as headphones, and for taking calls on my phone. I don't really use the buttons much, so can't really speak to those! The charging case is such a great touch - I have used these every day with my laptop for a few weeks and haven't really had to charge it yet. (I'm not doing anything that would use a ton of battery like listening to music - I'm mostly just working on my laptop and streaming the occasional meeting.) They pair easily, and the sound is great! Don't know that I need anything more than that! One point to note is that "noise canceling" is one of the features you can rate in this review, but I didn't rate it good or bad, since these are not noise canceling. That being said, when I'm using these with my computer, I only wear one in my ear because otherwise I can't hear anything around me.

Also, I want to mention that they fit my very small ears perfectly! I don't "plug" them fully into my ears, because they wouldn't stay in my small ear canals anyway, but the wraparound feature works great. I've even worn them to do an online workout! The plastic is soft and they are very comfortable. If I wear them all day, my ears will start to get a tiny bit sore, but nothing terrible and I'm sure I'll become accustomed to them.

I'd buy these again!
Hasta ahora excelente en todo sentido; veré cuánto tiempo funciona bien sin que tenga problemas de carga en los audífonos.

Eu daria nota 4.5, mas como não é possível ficou 4 mesmo. Ainda assim recomendo o fone, e ele vale o valor pago.

Vantagens:
- Bateria dura bastante (ainda não consegui calcular exatamente, mas consigo usar cerca de 2-3h por dia, 6 dias por semana sem precisar carregar a caixinha).
- Pareamento muito fácil.
- Modo único funciona perfeitamente: se estiver usando só um fone, basta tirar o outro da caixinha e eles pareiam automaticamente. Fazendo o inverso, guardando um fone, o outro não para de funcionar.
- Som razoável pelo preço.

Desvantagens:
- Uso há uns 2 meses, e até hoje não entendi em qual idioma ele fala (avisando sobre o pareamento, ligando/desligando, etc), e não encontrei informações sobre a possibilidade de configurar outra linguagem.
- Esse é o modelo T16. Já tive um T17, e comparando os dois, o som do T17 é muito melhor, principalmente nos graves. Inclusive a caixinha do T16 também carrega o T17!
- Botões de volume nos fones não funcionam (Também não funcionavam no T17), o que não é um problema grave, mas faltam informações sobre isso ser um defeito ou alguma configuração necessária extra que deva ser feita.

Only LH ear pod only one that is working.
I am trying to get the RH one replace
Amazon want me to send the set back
But using the left one when jogging
I how they can help me
Me encantaron, tienen funciones de vol, cbio de canción, etc. Cómodos y la batería si dura . Los uso una hr diario y me duró 30 días aproximadamente
Me gusto es bueno el producto solo q en algunas canciones no es muy envolvente como en otras

item39.name: Dastimasco Bone Conduction Headphones Bluetooth- 20 Hours Battery Life, Waterproof IP67 Open-Ear Sport Headphones with Mic- Wireless Headphones for Running Workouts Cycling, Black
item39.description:
Open-Ear Comfort: Indulge in unparalleled comfort with our lightweight, wireless, open-ear design bone conduction headphones, steering clear of the discomfort associated with in-ear or over-ear alternatives.
20-Hour Battery Life: Engineered for all-day continuous listening pleasure, our bone conduction headphones offer an impressive 20 hours of music, calls, and podcasts on a single charge. The quick charge chip allows for a 10-minute rapid charge, providing up to 2 hours of additional battery life.
Safety & Connectivity: Maintain awareness of your surroundings while immersing yourself in your favorite audio, striking a perfect balance between connectivity and safety.
IP67 Waterproof: Fully waterproof, our headphones are ideal for workouts, running, and hiking. Built to withstand dust, sweat, rain, and snow, they ensure you can pursue your training in any weather condition, opening up more possibilities for outdoor activities.
Secure Fit: Crafted with an ultra-lightweight (34g) titanium frame and utilizing ergonomic design principles, our headphones stay securely in place during intense training sessions. Say goodbye to discomfort, whether it's during commutes, work, entertainment, or workouts.
reviews: I absolutely love these. They r very comfortable to wear they every light weight the sound quality is amazing and the best part about it is that they don’t cause problems in the ear like my other ear buds do. It connects to my phone immediately when I turn them on. U can control your volume and skip the song from the head phone or answer and hang up your calls. It comes with a really nice carrying bag and the charger is magnetic so you don’t have to worry about it getting wore out and having hold it a certain way for you to charge all all I recommend everyone to buy these u won’t regret it

I got these for my son and they are nothing short of amazing. He has sensory issues so in the ear earbuds irk him. These fit comfortably around the ear and he absolutely loves them. The sound is clear, he can control the volume easily. Battery life is another main factor. He basically wore them all weekend and only had to charge once. The ear plugs they sent are also beneficial (I tried them myself) but not necessary. I will definitely be ordering again!

The Dastimasco Open-Ear Bluetooth Bone Conduction Headphones are excellent for clear conversations, thanks to their innovative design. The open-ear technology allows you to stay aware of your surroundings, making them perfect for calls on the go. While they may not deliver the deepest bass for music enthusiasts, their focus on conversation clarity sets them apart for those who prioritize communication over a bass-heavy audio experience.

I have so many issues wearing ear buds/Air Buds so I was happy to see some that didn’t go in the ear! These were easy to pair with my phone and the sound is very clear!!! I also enjoy that I don’t have to charge it every day since it has a 20 hour battery life

Love this style of headphones. Never heard or seen any like these. Fit great, love that you don’t have to put them in your ears. Quality is very good, great sound and fit.
Highly recommended!

I purchased them primarily for use on a Windows PC for Discord voice communication. Unfortunately the sound quality was not great and the speakers would actually vibrate on my head from time to time when sound came through which I found uncomfortable and sometimes even startled me. When I would talk others said I frequently sounded like a distorted robot or my voice was cutting in and out. There are very few settings for controlling sound quality. I ended up returning this product for a refund. I got a totally different model of wireless headphones and they are working great so it's not my hardware that was the problem.
Sound is perfect. Works without delay. Also very comfortable and stays in the ear well in movement.
Fantastic over the ear headphones. Very comfortable and very easy to use and set up. Highly recommend.

item40.name: Waterproof Over-Ear Headphones,V5.0 HD Stereo Sound Wireless Headphones with Mic, Passive Noise Cancelling Headsets for Gym Running Workout Men, Women
item40.description:
Much Better Sound - Powerful speaker with the BT 5.0 technology. High quality built-in microphones software and HD sound technology, offer you high fidelity stereo music with deep bass and crystal clear speech when you listen to music or watch movies.
Hand-free call & Built in Mic - Provide a quick and stable connection with your BT enabled devices like cell phones, tablets, PC, TVs within 33 feet, with a high-quality built-in microphone for hands-free calls, which is convenient for you to free yourself from wires.
Both Wireless and Wired Mode - BT headphones can work well both in wire and wireless mode. Battery can be used 20-hours music time/ talking time in a single charge for wireless mode. You can also use it as a wired headphone with the provided audio cable so the headphones will never power off.
Upgraded Soft Ear Cushions - Comfort with the professional protein earmuffs, More durability and comfort, enjoy high-quality, long-listen comfort, skin texture, light weight, comfortable around-ear fit you can wear all day long. Gentle Reminder: please take off the headphone every 2-3 hrs to get your ears relax, in order to get better hearing enjoyment, and keep the head comfortable.
We offer good customer service. If you have any question, please feel free to contact us.
reviews:
I'm a headphone enthusiast. Although, I have been through my fair share of headphones and earphones, I can definitely say without a doubt that these headphones are one of the best ones I've had. I had always bought Beats headphones because honestly I was buying the brand so people knew I was wearing trendy headphones but after a few uses of the Beats studio 3 wireless, the cushion started to peel off. Not only that, it affected the audio and it sounded mushy and really bad. It was hurting my ears. Yes, they were comfortable but after a long time they started to feel uncomfortable. Anyways, back to these headphones. In terms of cushion, it doesn't peel at all. I am a very sweaty dude and every headphone and earphone has stopped working after a few months because of sweat (I'm guessing) but these really did last long. They are rather uncomfortable, my left ear always ends up hurting the most even when I adjust them so the only issue I have with them is that when I'm trying to relax they always end up hurting my ear when I wear them too long.

The sound is crisp and clean. I was honestly expecting a raunchy sound from cheap headphones but boy oh boy was I incorrect. These headphones proved me wrong and they really show that even after workout sessions, they truly are a top quality headphone material.
Noise cancellation was also very very good. I can barely hear anything even when my volume is rather low. It's a good thing when you're in a library trying to listen to your music at a somewhat silent rate and at the same time, not hearing people around you whisper to each other. It really does do its justice and lives up to its expectations.
All in all, these headphones are amazing for such a cheap price. The sound is amazing, the ease of buttons is amazing, the fact that you can change the quality of sound is amazing, everything about these headphones are amazing. The only thing I would change is the comfortableness of the cushion because they kinda hurt after a while. Maybe it's my ears but hopefully for the next person they are okay with that feature. I recommend these headphones over any beats headphones out there without a doubt. Take it from me who spent about $320 on one pair. I could've bought these and extra pairs if another one stopped functioning rather than spending $200 on repairs for Beats. New buyers of sport headphones or any headphone users. PLEASE BUY THESE HEADPHONES! :D

left them in the car for two to three days and still had enough charge for the gym for a couple of hours. Once i started to play my music I heard absolutely nothing. The best headphones for the price.

They feel like kids dollar store headphones but the sound is clear and the Bluetooth connection works for a good distance. Perfect for the gym cause I would rather forget these at the gym then my beats. Also sweat will destroy the leather on the beats and this are still in tact after a few cardio sessions. Easy to connect. The buttons are kind of useless to me

so i think the age of me wearing airpods is over (just kidding, i have them on reserve for when these run out of battery) which prompted me to buy noise cancelling over-the-ear headphones. i was not disappointed.

not only are these extremely stylish, but they're cheap too. for the quality put into these, i wouldn't be surprised if they were over twenty. alas, the poor kids are in luck. they're very generous when you put them on, and when they're off, you can hang them around your neck no problem. they're super comfortable as well, given that the plush leather on the inside keeps your ears from feeling muffled. now if only i had that but for my gaming headphones.

the battery life lasts for quite some time and it's okay if you forget to turn off the headphones like i do on occasion because they do turn off automatically. if i had the space, i'd definitely buy another one just for the hell of it.
Of course they are cheap and mine broke after a drop off an end table but the sound is decent

I would like to start off being honest, these headphones are waterproof. You can shower with these things on (DO NOT SUBMERGE THIS HEADPHONES IN WATER, THESE ARE NOT FOR SWIMMING). And that's really the only good thing about it. When I received my headphones, the left earphone was already quieter than the right. I tried switching between mono and stereo sound to make a difference but it did nothing. The sound quality is not good to put it nicely. Even with the right headphone being the loudest, any earbuds or wires I ever had out did these headphones. After two days of using these headphones, I couldn't take it anymore and went to look inside the earphones. I find one of the wires thinning because the manufacturer did not add enough glue to make it stick. I found two wires thinner then shredded paper inside. When I tried to move the open earphone around to see if I could see anything else, the poorly glued wire popped off. So now my left earphone is permanently broken (Yes I tried to use foil and glue myself to fix it) and I'm waiting for a refund. Sure, you can say that my headphones were just a manufacturing mistake and buy them to see for yourself. But trust me random stranger, you DO NOT want these headphones! They may be cheap, but literally spending 10$ or even 5$ more can get you something 3x better.

To the manufactures if you are reading this, this product has A LOT of potential. You have the SD card, the radio, noise cancellation, and the battery life. The only problem is that these headphones are WAY too cheap! Please upgrade the wiring (please make them thicker, and maybe add more wiring if needed), and the sound quality (make the speakers, bigger, better, and louder). And maybe you can change the plastic casing of the headphones to make them feel less cheap, but I never really had a problem with that. I know these upgrades more than likely will raise the price of these headphones a little. But you should consider it because I had headphones and earbuds miles better than this for 5$ more.

I STRONGLY recommend to anyone thinking to buy this product, please go for something above 20 dollars. You will not regret spending your money on headphones that can last you months (or years) for something 5$ more than this!

item41.name: Sony MDRZX110NC Noise Cancelling Headphones, Black, medium
item41.description:
Integrated noise canceling technology.Specific uses for product : Personal, Business
Up to 80 hours of battery life
Lightweight for ultimate music mobility
Dynamic 1.18 in drivers
Swivel, folding design
Y-shaped cord type, 3.94 ft length
Connectivity Technology: Wired
reviews:
These headphones are awesome! Originally, I was looking for Bose-like headphones. I bought BOHM ones (off of Amazon) to try, and ended up returning them because there was no visible noise-cancellation (and they were close to $100). These have better noise cancellation - they definitely do not silence people around you, but they do make things quieter, even without music playing. With music playing, you can pretty much zone out, which is pretty much perfect. I've also tried a more expensive pair of Sony Headphones (they were close to $200) - I would say that the noise-cancelling feature is pretty much the same... at least, I didn't notice much of a difference between the two quality-wise. The more expensive Sonys were better quality in terms of material, look, and the speakers encapsulate your ears more effectively. But for the price, I would overwhelmingly choose these ones!
As an example, I'm currently writing this review in my apartment with the dish washer and dryer running... they're pretty loud. When I flip the noise-cancel switch (I don't have any music playing), the humming is gone, but I can still hear the swishing of the water in the dishwasher.
These headphones are perfect for when you're on the 'quiet' floor of the library, and that one person starts eating a bag of carrots... ugh that's the worst!
I also like how they fold up, I'm in college, so I just smoosh them into my backpack. They're much more comfortable than earbuds for studying, they don't hurt your ears.
Side note: I definitely prefer these to bluetooth headphones - you don't need to charge them, all you need is a single battery.

Overall, I'm very happy with my purchase. These are inexpensive, functional, and have great sound quality!
Good noise cancelling for the price. We use it on all our international flights and it definitely muffles all sounds. Hard to sleep with since they are bulky, but we still love it.

Compared to a set of Beats headphones, this is a good if not exceptional set of over-the-ear headphones. Recently I acquired a digital practice saxophone which, for latency reasons, only uses analog headphones for private practice so the Bluetooth only Beats wouldn’t work. Ear buds are not for me so I went looking for traditional wired headphones which are getting more rare as wireless technology gets better. That Sony now offers noise-reduction at a such a low price is an added benefit that I was keen to try out. The noise-reduction does work but at a much lesser level than you might get with more expensive headphones. Whether this is because of the hardware or because the ear muffs don’t isolate as well, I can’t say. Sound quality is decent, nothing great but nothing horrible either. For $30 this is a good deal.

They actually did moderate noise cancelling on the plane with the switch turned on. I use them a lot with the ROKU and the sound is great off the TV. nBattery lasts a long time if you remember to shut ir off after use.

I ordered these on a co-workers recommendation, but they may go back. Though comfortable for my couple hour long testing, the sound quality doesn't cut it for me. With power off the sound is dull & flat. Turning on power boosts the volume & adds a little clarity to the sound. I compared power on & off in various levels of constant background noise from a running fridge to a loud bathroom exhaust fan. With or without music playing the noise reduction was minimal. I don't expect them to match high end/priced models, but these don't cut down enough steady sound to stay in my bag of headphones. I hate to spend the money, but the $350 Sony phones did wonders to almost all the background noise in Best Buy... If only there were a middle ground for $100 to $200.

Update 2018.04.27: I've used these at work for a few days now. I rotate skiing these, old Bose, and new Mpow 059 phones. The 10 year old Bose sound better than the others, but let in too much external noise. We have a wire noise system at work that these Sony phones can't overcome. They got a bit uncomfortable after 6 hours or so. Still good sound for price though a pad where they sit on top of the head would be a nice addition.

Update 2018.04.30: The most maddening thing about these that I somehow neglected to point out is that the battery cover falls (fell) off almost daily and today I didn't notice and lost it somewhere. Now what?! Wish I returned them while I had all the parts.

These work very well and I'm excited that I tried them. And for the price they can't be beat. I do have to say that the noise cancelling is a bit weak but I compared them to 250.00 types so that isn't really fair. They do give some relief but in general the calls and sound is very clear and better than a pair that I paid over twice for. If you are on a tight budget and you need phones with these features then these are a winner.
This is great value for money. Got it for my spouse and kids and they all love it. Noise cancelling is spot one
Esta bien la relación costo material calidad
