item42.name: Sony WH-CH720N Noise Canceling Wireless Bluetooth Headphones - Built-in Microphone - up to 35 Hours Battery Life and Quick Charge - White
item42.description:
Enjoy natural vocals, crystal clear sound and balanced tuning thanks to the Integrated Processor V1 and Digital Sound Enhancement Engine (DSEE), producing a high quality sound exactly as the artists intended. Tailor sound to your personal preference using the EQ settings on the Sony | Headphones Connect app. 360 Reality Audio Certified – optimise your experience by analysing your individual ear shape on the Sony | Headphones Connect app, and enjoy the ultimate immersive music experience.
Digital Noise Cancelling headphones. Dual Noise Sensor technology and the Integrated Processor V1 let you adapt sound to your liking, and with the Sony | Headphones Connect app, you can adjust the ambient sound across 20 different levels for when you’re on the move.
Stays comfortable, however long you listen. A lightweight, ergonomic construction makes the most of the 35 hour* battery life, so these wireless headphones stay comfortable for long periods of listening. *With Noise Cancelling ON.
The WH-CH720N has Multipoint Connection, easy button operation, and can even be controlled with your voice. And since connection is easy with Swift pair and Fast Pair, these Sony headphones are ideal for everyday use.
With Precise Voice Pickup Technology, Wind Noise Reduction Structure, and beamforming mics to pick up your voice, you will enjoy clearer calls and better conversations with these over ear headphones.
reviews:
La batería dura bastante, es sencillo conectarlos con bluetooth y la calidad de sonido es muy buena.
También son muy cómodos, si utilizas lentes no lastiman, incluso usándolos durante largos períodos de tiempo.

Son suaves y aíslan bien el ruido natural de la calle, pueden ser un poquito grandes para llevar pero eso depende del gusto personal, en cuanto al audio son decentes para el precio, no espero un sonido definido ni muy nítido porque sé que no son de una gama alta, en conclusión para un uso normal y sin exigencias es bueno, si quieres algo de mejor calidad yo recomiendo invertir en una gama de más precio

La cancelación de ruido es muy buena, realmente te hace sentir aislado de ruidos externos además es compatible con la app para móvil y personalizar el sonido, también son muy cómodos y la batería dura por varios días a pesar de que los utilizo muchas horas
Entregado en tiempo y forma, funcionan muy bien y tienen un sonido y una conexion buena.

Boseのノイズキャンセリングイヤホンの片耳が聞こえなくなり購入しました。次買うならヘッドホンがいいなと考えていたところでBoseを見たら予算オーバーの為断念し、こちらを購入しました。
まず箱から出して本体を持った時の軽さに驚きました。ヘッドホンですがイヤホン+イヤホンケースと重さは変わらないのかなと思うほどです。
Boseにも似たオーバーイヤー型のヘッドホンがあり手に取った事がありますが断然こちらの方が軽いです。
音質も文句なし。しっかり外部の音が遮断される感じがあり最高です。イヤホン、ヘッドホン共に2年ほどで壊れるなら性能や音質を含めると値段も満足です。

item43.name: PHILIPS Fidelio L3 Flagship Over-Ear Wireless Headphones with Active Noise Cancellation Pro+ (ANC) and Bluetooth Multipoint Connection
item43.description:
PHILIPS’ HERITAGE OF 50+ YEARS in acoustic innovation has inspired Fidelio, the next generation of audio born from the pursuit of perfect sound. Fidelio L3 combines precise audio engineering and leading edge tech to deliver superior sound quality.
EXQUISITELY CRAFTED 40 MM DRIVERS make for natural, perfectly balanced notes—tight bass, smooth, rounded midrange and high frequencies that sparkle with detail.
STATE-OF-THE-ART HYBRID ACTIVE NOISE CANCELING (ANC): Two mics in each ear cup filter out unwanted sounds, leaving you free to immerse. Awareness mode is there to bring the outside world back to you when needed.
A MORE BESPOKE LISTENING EXPERIENCE is made possible by the Philips Headphones app. You can fine-tune your headphones’ sound profile and switch between different levels of noise cancelation..Note:If you face issue in Bluetooth connectivity please turn off the Bluetooth function for a couple of minutes, then turn it back on
ENJOY ABSOLUTE COMFORT AND LUXURY. Sleek, lightweight aluminum, Scottish Muirhead leather, and matte dark satin ear-cup rings ensure that these earphones feel as sumptuous as they sound.
BEST BLUETOOTH STREAMING SOUND QUALITY with AAC and aptX HD support. You can also connect to your high resolution equipment via a wired connection for even more details. These headphones are Hi-Res audio certified.
DUAL-CONNECTIVITY ENABLING SIMULTANEOUS CONNECTION: Fidelio L3 can also connect to two Bluetooth devices at once. Ideal if you want to hear notifications from your phone while streaming videos from your laptop.
reviews:
These have the most solid and premium build quality of any headphone I've tested in this price range ($200-350). The leather is beautiful and supple, the metal arms seem bombproof, and the plastic used for the earcups is of the highest quality. I love that the leather is used for the earcups, which allows for a cool, very comfortable sensation against the head, as well as the headband. The Fidelio L3 logo is subtly embossed at the center of the headband. The earcups are perfect circles, giving the headphones an elegant and timeless design.

In short, I love these headphones.

Of course, in this category of high-end ANC headphones, the benchmark is the Sony XM4. I have been testing these Fidelios against my new (Dec 2021) Sony XM4s. In terms of build quality, these L3s *blow the Sony's out of the water.* By comparison, the Sony's feel cheap and like they'll crack at any moment - and, in fact, there are a number of reviewers who have ran into exactly that problem. (Take a look at the numerous images of cracked and useless XM4s on their Amazon page.) The Sony's seem to have a structural weakness at the pivot where the earcup connects to the headband, and too many people for me to feel comfortable with have reported the headphones snapping at that point. Sony customer service refuses to repair or replace these, even if it's within warranty, because they consider it "damage." This has practical consequences; if I want to take a nap with my headphones on, I always choose the Fidelios because the Sony's make me afraid that if I turn on my side and put pressure against the earcup, they will snap. At this price point, Sony should be doing much, much better. My opinion is that Sony has become accustomed to the fact that everyone seems to consider the XM4s the best-in-class, and, as a result, the company has become lazy, seeking to maximize their margins by using cheap plastics, fake leather, and generally neglecting the build quality.

Can you imagine dropping $350 on your headphones, only to have them snap on you within a year? That's insane.

So, in short, the Fidelios seem to me to offer the best build quality of any headphones in this price range. I think I'll be able to throw them into my bag when I'm rushing off to work or traveling for years to come and not worry about any damage. They are that solid. They are a pleasure to hold and look at.

With all of that said, the Fidelios are not as excellent when it comes to the sound and ANC. I can tell that the XM4s have better noise cancelling than the Fidelios. Even worse, I have noticed a very subtle high pitched tone coming from the Fidelios at times, mostly when the volume is up high. I'm still testing to see whether it's a problem with my Bluetooth connection or audio player, but I think it may simply be a defect.

The other issue I've noticed is that the mic on the Fidelios hasn't been super clear on my Zoom calls. (I'm on a 2018 Surface 6 Tablet, so that may have something to do with it.) That's a major drawback for me, but it's not an issue when they are plugged in. I also have about 5 or 6 Bluetooth connections going on at the same time and that's caused connectivity issues with the Sony's too, so I need to continue testing once I've reduced the number of Bluetooth connections. When I remove the other Bluetooth connections, I haven't had issues.

(In case you run into the same issue, there is a reliable workaround: Get yourself a BT receiver, such as the TP-Link USB Bluetooth Receiver. The issue seems to stem from the BT connections interfering with each other.)

This is the first year that the Fidelios have been out and I am confident that with the next iteration, Philips will get better at the ANC. I expect these headphones to quickly overtake the XM4s in the years to come. They just need to develop the audio quality. Philips has phenomenal sound quality on some of its other headphones, such as the open-backed Fidelio X2HRs, which I also love. (The soundstage and overall sound quality on these is noticeably better than the XM4s and Fidelio L3s.) The question is whether the headphone review industry will move on from its fixation on the XM4s, as far as public recognition goes.

I highly recommend these headphones, but you will need to test them with your actual use-cases to figure out whether they match what matters most to you.

This headset is amazing when it works, BUT, my unit came extremely bad:
Wear sensor doesn't actually works, it pauses the reproduction when you lower or unwear the headset, but it doesn't turn it on when you wear again, need to restart the device everytime, so decided to just disable that feature every time I switch the headset on
Multi link works 50% of the time, the other 50% it can't get paired with laptop and smartphone at the same time, no matter how many times I try to pair, or how many combinations of "laptop first - smartphone first" I do
Now it suddenly started to auto shutoff while playing media, for no reason, again need to restart the device and sometimes, to re-pair.

So to make a resume:
Pros: amazing sound, really well build quality and transport bag+case, really confortable, ANC works great on all modes, lots of playtime per charge and it charges pretty quickly

Cons: mobile app its really slugish (even on a top-of-the-line smartphone), audio cable is REALLY thin (really, like half the diameter of a classic audio cable); and at least on my unit, multilink not working, same as wear sensor, and that random shutoffs

(Yes I tried to contact to Philips, but NEVER got a reponse)

I was in the market to replace some Soundcore Q30s that I got a few years of use out of. I really enjoyed them, however, they fell apart beyond what electrical tape and super glue could remedy. In a market saturated with low to mid priced options and questioning Soundcore's build quality, I embarked on a quest for a serviceable pair of headphones for under $100. After going 0/3, I took a shot in the dark with the Philips TAH 9505 headphones. I purchased them used for $42 and change on Amazon. Result: Pleasantly surprised! The sound quality is better than the Q30s IMO, especially in the mid to high ranges. The pads for the ears are thick and quite comfortable, though the phones clamp a little tight. ANC is good enough for me, while the cups seal quite well, eliminating the need for ANC in many situation. All that being said, if you're frustrated by the lack of solid and affordable options, give these a try.

These are some very good headphones, overall. They have good sound quality, they’re pretty easy to pair, and they have pretty long battery life. The noise canceling isn’t the best, but they cut out a decent amount of sound. The case that they come with is simple, but it’s very nice. However, they do have some flaws. They aren’t the most comfortable, as I’ve found that I have to take them off and wait a bit before I can wear them again. They also have some mild inconveniences about them, like the obnoxious touch controls, and that they make weird noises once in a while. Despite that, though, these are overall very good. I recommend them

These arrived a day earlier than expected and I was so excited to test them out. So far, the L3s perform very well for the price, noise cancellation is very effective, and it sounds really good with all the songs I've tested on it, it also works quite well for gaming which is sort of a given, however my only complaints thus far is that I can't seem to use these plugged into my PC via both USB-C and the included audio jack, both of which are fairly thin cables, overall though I would recommend these just for their performance alone.
Me encantaron.. buen sonido y muy cómodos.

First the good. Sound is very good, I like the "Awareness On" mode so I can hear people talking to me, and it is comfortable and has a long battery life.
Ok, construction materials for the headband - fire the engineer who selected a brittle spring material. Mine broke in 2 audible cracks right in the middle after a few months. Fortunately it still holds ok on my head, but honestly, they did zero durability testing on this. That is not what I expected from Philips.
Now there is a software app that you need to download to get to some of the options. No one from Phillips did any product testing with any significant cross section of real users.
1. On-headset buttons don't always work. For example the button turning awareness on, or more frequently the TouchPad sensor does not pause or raise volume etc. To fix this I need the software interface on my Samsung S20 FE phone and toggle touchpad sensor on/off switch. This software sometimes will not boot up, and I need to close and reopen the software. Then every time it takes at least 24 seconds to start.
Philips is proud of their "wear sensor". This is supposed to pause whenever you remove the headset. That would be great, but mine also pauses if I tip my head forward or move my head too fast, and then it doesn't resume. I have to hold my hand over the TouchPad sensor as a hack to resue play, but at this point it is even more sensitive and pauses for very minor movements. Way too sensitive. So I usually turn off the wear sensor - which doesn't always work right away.
But headphones are forgetful you see, and so next time you turn them on, it assumes it knows what you want - which is its default settings. NC on -not awareness on as I last used, wear sensor on - not off like I prefer, so I will fiddle with the buttons to get what I want. Honestly, does 8 bits of memory cost too much or did no one consider users would like to save their last settings?

I bought these headphones for my wife for her birthday for her to use in her office for meetings and listening to music. The sound was great and so was the microphone but only a few months after we bought them the plastic on the side cracked and the headphone would no longer sit flush to her ear. This is after only regular wear and tear in a controlled environment. For over 200 dollars I can't believe they were this cheaply made! My children have 20 dollar headphones that haven't broken like this after being sat on and dropped over and over again. Buyer beware!

I tried to use Philips warranty to replace the headphones. It was like a black hole of emails and phone calls between 3 different departments. I was feeling stubborn so I persisted for 3 months in following up and checking to make sure our case was being dealt with but after 3 months we were told the warranty doesn't cover wear and tear. So that was that... I can't say how disappointed I am in what I thought was a great company.

The noise cancelling was not well enough for my taste. I was still able to hear my husband talking while I was listening to my music. The sound was very good. I did find the ears on the headset were heavy. My biggest complaint was that the only way to increase and decrease the volume or skip songs was on the ear set. All you had to do was swipe your finger across, up or down on the ear piece. If you didn’t touch it in the exact spot or if your swipe was a little off. Sometime when I swiped up to increase the sound it would not work. When I wanted to skip a song it would replay instead of skip. I found that very frustrating. Maybe it was because the touch pad was too sensitive. The quality was there, just not practical. I did return it

item44.name: phonicgrid SE7 Hybrid Active Noise Cancelling Headphones Wireless Bluetooth Headphones Noise canceling Wireless Headphones Over Ear, ENC Calls, Deep Bass, Bluetooth 5.2, 30H for Enjoy, Gold
item44.description:
Immerse Yourself in Music with No Distractions - Our SE7 Bluetooth headphones feature enhanced active noise technology, reducing up to 95% of low-frequency noises around you. Enjoy your music without any interruptions, even in noisy environments, and get fully immersed in your favorite tunes when owning SE7 active noise cancelling headphones.
Crystal Clear Calls, Anytime, Anywhere - With premium built-in microphones and ENC technology, our SE7 wireless headphones provide crystal clear and stable hands-free calls. No more poor or intermittent conversations. As SE7 headphones with mic, stay connected with your circle wherever you are.
Comfortable, Lightweight Design for All-Day Listening - Our SE7 over ear headphones are designed for ultimate comfort and relaxation. The lightweight design and super imitation protein leather make for a no-pressure and comfortable fit, so you can wear them all day long with ease.
Amazing Audio Quality for a Truly Immersive Experience - With advanced speaker diaphragm and chip, our SE7 headphones deliver impeccable sound quality. The 40mm Large Aperture Drivers transmit every detail of audio to your ears perfectly, so you can hear your music exactly as it was intended to be heard.
30 Hours for Listening - A full charge for 30 hours of continuous music playback time. Adjustable headband for a more comfortable fit. Having a longer time for comfortable listening with our SE7 Bluetooth headphones is never a difficulty. Include components: SE7 headphone, charging cable,3.5mm aux cable, user guide, and portable case.
reviews: I have been using these headphone for a couple of weeks now and I must say I’m very pleased by the purchase. They connected easily to Bluetooth. The sound quality and tonal range are very good. The active noise canceling works remarkably well and the unidirectional sensitivity of the microphone is excellent. They are light to wear and seem very comfortable after several hours and have a long battery life for music and voice. The case that comes with them is small and sturdy. Overall I have to say they are the best headphone sets I have used (or the price.

These headphones are exceptional value for their cost of only $50. Serving as an integral part of my professional setup at a video production studio, these headphones have proven their very impressive sound quality in my editing work. I’ve also been using them for gaming on my Steam Deck. Especially impressive is the device's battery life, offering a personally verified 30 hours of continuous playback time.

The design merits recognition for its well-thought-out user experience, it’s lightweight frame allows comfort for an entire day's wear without imposing discomfort, credited to its super soft imitation protein leather padding. The simple connectivity afforded by the choice of Bluetooth and wired options simplifies the user experience (My mother who is NOT good with technology was able to connect instantly with her iPad pro). The design of these are also great. Easily adjustable with a sleek aesthetic design holding its own against more prominent brands. The product package is complete with a user guide, charging cable, a 3.5mm aux cable, and a handy portable case (That I’ve been using to bring to work). All in all, I highly recommend them.

These headphones are by far the best Noise isolating ANC I have personally come across, and the ENC microphones make calls are crystal clear!

Using the app you can really fine tune how you want them to sound, with 3 different options for ANC, and several EQ options for music

You can also use the buttons on the right headphone to toggle the ANC settings without using the app, as well as buttons for volume control, and the power on/off button.

My first pair worked incredibly for a few days and were going to be my new daily headphones, but sadly wouldn't charge up again around 6 days in. Absolutely bummed about this I contacted the company and let them know what happened and they sent me a replacement pair!

They just arrived today and sound just as amazing as the first pair did!

Such an amazing company and such an underrated pair of headphones, I couldn't recommend these more they outpace many high end headphones on the market right now for a much better price.
I hit one button to turn on and it’s already trying to pair with my TV and devices. It was so quick and easy and the sound is incredible in my ears. Comfortable too. Very pleased!

I needed noise-canceling headphones for an upcoming flight because I’m a nervous flyer and thought they would help. I rarely fly so I thought I’d see if I could find some decent ones at a lower price. These had good reviews, but I made the rookie mistake of not reading the bad ones, too. Here’s my experience:

Pros
Received them on time
They’re pretty comfortable
The case is nice and the headphones curl up nicely in it

Cons
Anytime you power it on/off, connect/disconnect Bluetooth, or turn on/off the noise-canceling, a woman’s voice screams it out at you. It startled me and I didn’t even have them on my ears yet, I can’t imagine what it sounds like when you’re wearing them.

They ask you to download an app called SoundCloud - it has a grand total of 2 reviews as I’m writing this on 10/03/23 and there’s one star. Needless to say I didn’t download it.

You can scan a QR code to get an “extended warranty” - but the only way to complete it is to give a review. How can I review something I’ve never used? So I skipped that, too. I guess I could’ve waited until after I tried them out, but I’ve never had a company require a review to get the warranty before so I was suspicious.

There’s a card in the case that offers something free if you leave a five star rating with “no words and no photos”, then take a screenshot of the review and send that and your order ID to an Outlook email address. I’ve been an Amazon shopper for many years and never seen anything like that before - makes me question every good review on here.

The “noise-canceling” is laughable. It even says in the instructions for use that it only works for low-frequency noise and not high-frequency, like human voices. You get what you pay for so I guess I should’ve kept my expectations low.

Returning these things was a hassle. I couldn’t drop it off at the local Amazon drop off merchant where you literally hand over the product, they scan the QR code in the app, and that’s it - I had to package it up, print out and tape the return label on the box, and drop it off at UPS. First world problem, I know. But it was still a waste of my time.

These have been wonderful - after reading other reviews I decided on these for travel/working out. The band is a little big and slips occasionally but not enough to get annoyed. Sound works great, noise canceling feature drastically reduced all noise as promised. The ear cushions are very nice, no ear pain with extended use. Recommend!

These are really good headphones for a really great price. They very loud, which is amazing🙌🏾; and don’t get me started on the noise cancellation, love that! The only problem I’ve really ran into so far is they kinda lag/Glitch when I try to watch YouTube or Netflix. But everything is working great 😌 4.5⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️💫
Good value for the money and comfortable

item45.name: iClever HS19S Kids Headphones with Mic, 85/94dB Volume Limiter - Shareport - Over Ear Stereo Headphones for Kids Boys Girls, Foldable 3.5mm Jack Wired Headphones for iPad/Tablet/School/Travel
item45.description:
【85/94dB Safe Volume Control】: Specially designed for children, the kids headphones can be limited to a sound level of 85dB to prevent damages to kid's ears in daily life, and also allow to reach 94dB for clearer but still safe sound under the condition of airplane rumbles, car noises etc.
【Built-in Microphone & Great Compatibility】: iClever wired headphones work with the In-line microphone making them perfect for Online Courses and Voice calls. These Over-Ear headphones support devices with 3.5mm audio jack like Chromebook, Kindle Fire Tablet, Switch, iPad, Laptop, PC etc.
【Stereo Sound & Share Port】 : With built-in 40mm drivers, our headphones emit a full balanced stereo sound, making them perfect for playing games and listening to music. Kids can insert another headphone plug into the sharing jack to share audio with friends or families, no splitters or special cables needed.
【Comfort Wear & Foldable Design】 : The ultra-soft earmuffs and over-ear design make better isolation from ambient noise and good breathability, thus your kids won't feel tired even for a long-time wear. kids headphones for travel are foldable and compact, convenient for carrying and storage.
【Generous Warranty】 : At iClever, we always put customers first, and we're proud to stand by the quality of our products. You are entitled to enjoy 24-hour Customer-friendly Support Service. Any questions please feel hassle-free to contact us.
reviews: My son really loves these earphones! The cord ripped after a few months and they replaced it without any questions! Amazing customer service.

Kindergartner loves these headphones. He chose them due to the vivid colors. They are comfortable, easy to put on and keep on and has good sound quality. Have been durable. He’ll be able to continue use these through elementary school due to the size adjustment available. A great value for this product.

I recently purchased the iClever HS19 Kids Headphones with Microphone for my 7-year-old's long plane ride, and I must say they were an absolute lifesaver! These headphones turned out to be the perfect travel companion, providing a comfortable and enjoyable experience for my little one.

First and foremost, the design and size are ideal for young children. The headphones fit perfectly over my 7-year-old's ears without feeling too tight or uncomfortable, allowing him to wear them for an extended period without any complaints. The adjustable headband is a thoughtful feature that ensures a secure fit as he grows.

The sound quality was excellent, striking a perfect balance between clear audio and child-safe volume levels. I appreciated the thoughtful consideration put into protecting young ears while still delivering an enjoyable listening experience. The headphones provided crystal-clear sound, making it easy for my child to enjoy his favorite music and watch videos during the long plane ride.

Additionally, the headphones' durability and sturdiness were evident throughout the trip. Despite being used by a playful and energetic 7-year-old, they held up remarkably well, showing no signs of wear and tear.

Another feature I appreciated was the foldable design, making it easy to store the headphones in our carry-on bag without taking up much space. It added to the convenience of travel and ensured that the headphones remained protected during transit.

In conclusion, the iClever HS19 Kids Headphones with Microphone proved to be a fantastic investment for our long plane ride. They provided excellent sound quality, a comfortable fit, and a convenient microphone for communication. With their durable build and child-friendly design, these headphones are sure to be a reliable companion for any young traveler or music enthusiast. I highly recommend them to parents looking for high-quality headphones for their kids!

I've bought several of these for my kids. Love them, but have had to replace two of them in a year's time. One broke when my son was taking them off (could entirely be him being rough on them, but alas, they still broke) and the mic went out on one other pair. Still like them, love that they fold up, have microphones and sturdy, cloth-covered cords. They're also comfortable for my kids.

We ordered one for our son, age 6, for when we travel. We were impressed with how well it works. We also like that it has ear protection, as well as the option to make it louder for ambient noise like on airplanes. We ordered another one for him to use at school, and we also ordered one for his sister. The one we ordered for school broke recently, and it was still under a year. So we contacted customer service, and they were fantastic! They replied quickly, attempted to troubleshoot the issue, and then they sent us a replacement for our broken one, when it was clear it couldn’t be fixed. For the price, quality, and service- buying this is a no-brainer. And the other headphones we have from them for longer have had no issues and work well. Highly recommend.
My kid has high functioning autism and he has never complained about these as he usually does with other headphones! Very durable and good sound for the price!

Originally purchased our first pair for distance learning as our sons had to share a room and were in separate classes. They worked great to help them stay focused and hear only their class. Mic worked great as well for the teacher to hear them. Purchased again for in school use while doing their independent computer work and they work great with no issues.

I buy these several times a year for my kids and they are perfect! They typically last anywhere from 4-6 months before one of my kids accidently bends the prong where they plug in. I usually purchase two at a time so I always have a backup.
We've tried other kids headphones and they just don't hold up nearly as long.

Bought for school use to plug into school devices when working independently. The volume limits was one of the key things I wanted and it delivered. The size/fit was also great for my kid (8) at the smallest setting. And I myself was able to wear them when both sides were extended to the fullest (gives about 1 inch additional height on both sides). As mentioned because I was able to put them on my head, I was able to confirm the volume was at an acceptable level.

A couple more things I hope to test in the next little while would be the button control (start/stop/skip music) and the "listen together" jack. will report back when that is done :) Will also see how it holds up to real life kid usage.

Colors are a nice pastel shade and my daughter loves it. Still a little bulky when folded together and the cord is long (necessary but I also foresee spaghetti mess) but we put it into our own drawstring bag so she can keep it in a bundle. If one was included that would have been icing on the cake.

Satisfaite de mon achat pour mon fils de 8 ans afin qu'il puisse écouter ses histoires avec sa conteuse. La qualité est bonne, le casque semble robuste. Le son n'est pas trop faible et de bonne qualité. J'apprécie le fait qu'il puisse se plier pour se ranger plus facilement. Mon fils est ravie.

Light weight , comfortable to wear , so I've been told by my 8yr old :) she love's the sound quality and the colour combination, They seem too be made sturdy with good quality plastics
, good length of cable and head adjustment ,
........( we will see how long they last ,,,,, I will update this review if they break :P )........ The ear and head padding are nice'n soft ,, she was wearing these as soon as they were delivered and watched one of her films which was about 1hr 35minutes long with no problems , she didnt get any ear ache which you sometimes get when wearing these type of headphones squashing the ears, because they are softly padded , she also liked the control button on the lead so she could pause and unpause the film when needed :) overhaul she's happy with them ,.As an adult I also found them to be comfortable to wear with ther adjustments easily made either side , They do have a nice clear crisp sound and decent bass tone ... we was using a samsung tablet
Cuffia molto bella l' audio si sente bene.

Acquistate per un bambino. Funzionano benissimo, sono leggere e comode.
Mi ha convinto in modo particolare la regolazione del volume, che è impostato per non superare deteminati decibel, in modo da salvaguardare le orecchie dei più piccoli.

reviews: I was concerned at first because the outside of the box said these headphones were great for kids 3+. The ultimate test was when the actual owner of the headset (the kid of course), was excited immediately because of how the color popped. He also "LOVED" how the cushion felt. It seems durable and I appreciate that it folds quite easily. For the cost, it's definitely a great choice for kids that need to bring in headphones at school.

reviews: These headphones are absolutely amazing quality, I'm glad I bought them! I thought that these were just bluetooh headphones, but they also come with two headphone jacks; with and without a microphone! The audio quality is amazing, and they're super comfy and adjustable. They are noise canceling for the most part, if you don't have audio playing then they aren't completely noise canceling, but other than that, these are the best headphones ever!!

Alright. Usually I'm a bit too lazy to right reviews but I just gotta say these are great.
I have some higher quality pricier over the ear headphones and I keep reverting back to using these. They're light, comfortable, the battery life is great and they look awesome.
Plus I'm noticing the range of the Bluetooth seems to be better than my higher price headphones. I can leave my phone in my bedroom and be out in the living room and these stay connected while my higher price headphones seem to cut out at that distance.
Plus, these seem to sit on my head better than my more expensive headsets too.
Honestly I got these because they were a cheaper option at the time, but I still use these just about daily and only end up using my higher prices headphones while this set is charging.
This is by far the best headset I have.

I bought these headphones to see how they stood up to the Skullcandy Crusher Evo Headphones.

Though they are just as attractive and really comparable, the sound quality on them isn't as solid. They are a good option for 1/3 off the price. They are also more comfortable in that they are lighter on the head for long term wear and they come with a sturdier case - which were pluses.

They connect easily to bluetooth and are a great budget friendly option, though I chose to splurge on the SC.

Well done! Recommended based on budget and usage.
I bought a pair of these for my son and a pair for myself. They are really good headphones overall; comfy with good sound quality, but we both agree the battery life could be better.

I adore these headphones. Very comfortable, they cancel sounds so I can block out my older sister, battery charge is excellent, mic quality is great, I can call my grandma and she can hear me clearly. Plus the snake pattern, I love it! If I'm satisfied with how long I can use them before they retire, I'll come get another!

They sound great to me. But I'm no expert on soud quality, so my satisfaction may be your disappointment. Bass is there but not as extreme as the description makes it sound.

Battery life is average. My last pair could go four days of continuous use on one full charge whereas this one barely just barely makes it to 48 hours. Might do you better if you use your headphones less often than I do.

When I used these headphones with my HP Laptop (especially on Youtube or similiar video hosting sites) I have to be careful not to pause the media too often or leave it pause to long, because when I press play again no sound will come through the heaphones even though its connected and the video is clearly playing. I used to be able to fix this by refreshing the page but that stopped working, so now I have to disconnect the bluetooth entirely and connect it again to fix it. I don't have this issue when connected to my phone.

The play/pause and foward/backward buttons on the headphones do not work on Youtube on my phone. Only volume commands work. However, my phone is a geriatric mess by smartphone standards so this might not be a problem with more recent models.

All in all, could do better but not entirely awful for 48 dollars. The lights are cute.
Great headphones and comfortable to wear. Worth the money and i love the galaxy design.
I like these they work pretty well. I like the lights on them too.
So far I’m really happy with these! Nice and soft but sturdy

item49.name: JLab JBuddies Studio Over-Ear Kids Wired Headphones, Toddler Headphones, Kid Safe, Studio Volume Safe, Volume Limiter, Folding, Adjustable, Noise Isolation, with Mic (Pink)
item49.description:
***The Wirecutter's corded headphone pick for older kids and safe listening***
Over Ear design with comfy Eco Leather Cushions and padded headband offer all-day comfort for all ages, from grade school tykes to teens.
What would great style be without performance? The JBuddies offer safe-volume control, with built-in volume regulators, to ensure kids never rock out past 85db. And each pair is still designed with JLab's high-performance sound standards in mind.
Whenever, Wherever: Hook up the tangle free, braided-nylon cord equipped with an in-line mic for taking calls, firing up your tunes, pausing them and controlling the tracks on your mix. The 90 degree jack rocks with all devices and cases. And the compact, adjustable headband fits growing kids from ages 6-16.
Includes: JBuddies Studio Headphones w/ volume regulator for kids * Stainless Steel Headband w/ Plush Memory Foam Cushion * In-Line Universal Mic w/ Track Control * Endless Comfort w/ Cloud Foam cushions * Compact, Folding Design * 40mm Drivers * Frequency: 20Hz-20kHz * Braided nylon cord with 90 degree jack * JLab's 30 Day Satisfaction Guarantee * Lifetime Limited Warranty
reviews:
I've been a loyal fan of the JLab JBuddies Studio On-Ear Kids Wired Headphones for years, and they have never let me down. These headphones have become a staple for my twins, both at home and school, and here's why I give them a well-deserved 5-star rating:

1. **Durability:** These headphones are built to withstand the wear and tear of active kids. Over the years, they've endured countless drops, tugs, and twists and are still going strong. That kind of durability is hard to beat!

2. **Comfortable Fit:** My twins find these headphones comfortable to wear for extended periods. The on-ear design is just the right size for their little ears and provides a secure fit without being too tight.

3. **Safe Volume Levels:** I appreciate the built-in volume control that ensures my kids' delicate ears are protected. It's a reassuring feature for a parent.

4. **Tangle-Free Cord:** The tangle-free cord design is a small but appreciated detail. It saves us from the frustration of untangling knots every time they want to use their headphones.

5. **Clear Sound:** Despite being budget-friendly, these headphones deliver surprisingly clear and crisp sound quality, allowing my kids to enjoy their music, movies, or educational content without any compromise.

6. **Priced Right:** The affordability of these headphones is a major plus. I've bought multiple pairs over the years, and it doesn't break the bank.

7. **Variety of Colors:** The availability of different colors is a nice touch, allowing my twins to pick their favorite and express their individuality.

In summary, the JLab JBuddies Studio On-Ear Kids Wired Headphones have been a reliable and cost-effective choice for my twins. They're built to last, comfortable to wear, and offer peace of mind with safe volume levels. I highly recommend them to other parents looking for durable and reasonably priced headphones for their kids. These headphones easily earn a 5-star rating!

We love these headphones for our little one. He's got a pair for at home and a pair that was sent in to school for their media/computer time there. Flexible and durable - they've held up really well to a lot of use.
From the child for whom they were purchased: "They're really good; they work on my iPad [at school]."
For the price these are great quality kids headphones. We bought these things to replace more expensive headphones and we are now fans of these. Buy some for your kids. They work great!

These fit my giant-headed almost-7 year old perfectly; probably with a little room to grow. They're comfortable and get the job done easily. They seem sturdy, too. Will update after he's used them for a while, we'll see how well they stand up to him. Thanks for a great looking product!

PS - packaging was great too, nice and simple.

So far so good. Just received this tonight and tested it out. It has very good audio quality for the price and purpose, and the volume limiting circuitry seems to do the job; the volume can get loud, but not loud enough to hurt the ears. I would still advise your child to exercise responsibility and only set the volume high enough to hear and no more, but it's nice to know it has that extra protection in case a device is capable of putting out too much volume and is set too high on initial activation. The look and construction are both very good, and I have high confidence this will perform well for its purpose in grade school. If it turns out to not be as durable as I expect, my review and rating here will change.

The fit is very good for a kid grade school that is beyond their toddler/kindergarten years.
Good quality and sound

I purchased these and some JBL JR 300 to gift to a younger family member. I decided to test both and see which would end up being the better headphones.

The JBuddies feel like they are made of stronger material, except the size adjustments sliders, which are just a couple of thin metal rods per side that seemed like they could get bent out of shape pretty easy. They also had a vulnerable point, the signal wires going to the ear cups are exposed and could snag on something or get pulled by absent minded fingers.

The JBL JR 300 felt a little more plasticky, not much more. Also the fake leather covering the ear pads felt thinner. However there were no vulnerable wires or any overt weak points and no exposed signal wires. The cord is not a round wire, it is flat like a ribbon which feels kind of thin compared to a traditional round wire.

I used a basic sound meter (factory calibrated, not certified) to test how loud they would get. Quieter is safer for young ears, so lower dB is better. Safety standards that are often quoted claim 85dB is the upper limit for safe sound levels.

The JBuddies won out here, they wouldn't go past about 80dB no matter how much I tried to push them. The JBL JR 300 went right up to the line at 85dB.

Next was sound quality, tested by having me and another family member listen to a variety of music.

The JBL JR 300 easily won this comparison. The sound was cleaner, clearer, and bass/midrange/treble were balanced very well. These sound like adult headphones, just not as loud.

The JBuddies had a touch too much midrange and lower treble. This gave them a sort of muffled sound. I found myself trying hard to hear some instrument, voice, or other sound.

I ended up keeping the JBL JR 300, to gift to my family, and sending the JBuddies back. My reasoning was two-fold.

First, the JBuddies thin metal rods and exposed signal wire don't inspire any confidence in it's ability to survive life with kids. The JBL JR 300 is a more solid structure and feels more kid-proof.

Second, while the JBuddies maxed out at a lower volume, the more muffled sound quality caused me to want to listen at the higher volumes just to try and hear things better. The JBL JR 300, being clean and clear allowed me to hear at lower volumes and did not make me feel the need to turn it up.

With a few adjustments, the JBuddies could be great kids headphones, I hope JLab refines them and puts out a better product in the future. I love their Retro Rewind Headphones, so I know they can put out something with more quality. Right now, the JBL JR 300 get my vote.
Mis audífonos llegaron dañados de la entrada, adicional solo se escucha el del lado derecho.
Good sound regulation not crossing proper limit, comfortable for kid, she likes it. Will see how long it will last working properly, until now 5 stars. For 19CAD it was a good price for it.
Köpte två. En hade glappkontakt direkt från start så gick inte att använda.
No tienen volumen, y para un niño de 9 años son pequeños, mis hijos dicen que son incómodos
Cuffie per bambini, ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo

JLab JBuddies Studio Over-Ear Kids Wired Headphones, Toddler Headphones, Kid Safe, Studio Volume Safe, Volume Limiter, Folding, Adjustable, Noise Isolation, with Mic (Pink) ***The Wirecutter's corded headphone pick for older kids and safe listening***
Over Ear design with comfy Eco Leather Cushions and padded headband offer all-day comfort for all ages, from grade school tykes to teens.
What would great style be without performance? The JBuddies offer safe-volume control, with built-in volume regulators, to ensure kids never rock out past 85db. And each pair is still designed with JLab's high-performance sound standards in mind.
Whenever, Wherever: Hook up the tangle free, braided-nylon cord equipped with an in-line mic for taking calls, firing up your tunes, pausing them and controlling the tracks on your mix. The 90 degree jack rocks with all devices and cases. And the compact, adjustable headband fits growing kids from ages 6-16.
Includes: JBuddies Studio Headphones w/ volume regulator for kids * Stainless Steel Headband w/ Plush Memory Foam Cushion * In-Line Universal Mic w/ Track Control * Endless Comfort w/ Cloud Foam cushions * Compact, Folding Design * 40mm Drivers * Frequency: 20Hz-20kHz * Braided nylon cord with 90 degree jack * JLab's 30 Day Satisfaction Guarantee * Lifetime Limited Warranty

item50.description:
[100% FOCUS and 90% BLOCK of the AMBIENT NOISES] –Wireless headphones equipped with the latest active noise cancelling technology which ensures your perfect dedication by removing all distractions like street traffic, airplane engine and neighbors parties. Probably the best choice for affordable noise cancelling headphones - maximum joy guaranteed.
[LONG PLAYTIME & AUX MODE] – Forget the frustrating moments when charging your headphones is daily routine. Our bluetooth headphones ensure you super long playtime thanks to its low consumption technology. Enjoy weeks of music and movies without any charging necessities and don’t worry if your battery is 0%, as all wired headphones you can continue with the 3.5mm aux cable.
[BALANCED AUDIO – Hi-Fi STEREO] – Tired of many poor sounding headphones and lack of bass? We feel you! Our over-ear headphones are equipped with upgraded audio drivers which will deliver incredible Hi-Fidelity sound enriched with deep bass and extended treble. Feel each instrument from your favorite music and let it make you feel happiness like never before.
[BUILT-IN MIC] – Speak proudly in every virtual meeting and online class you may attend. Headphones with noise cancelling microphone for clear hassle hands-free calls. Lightweight designed structure that is equipped with fully over the ear soft memory foam earmuffs and extendable metal sides to ensure your long term wearing comfort. Built with highest quality materials so the premium feeling from the first touch is guaranteed.
[Backed UP with 2 Years WARRANTY] – Get the perfect gift for your loving ones. Headphone that pairs instantly to Phones, Tablets, Laptops, PC and TV. Unlike others which offer you only 1 Year Warranty and slower support, By choosing PowerLocus, You are covered with 2 Years warranty and 100% Customer satisfaction – 24/7 Customer Support. Simply get in touch with us via amazon and we will solve your problem within less than 2 hours.
reviews: Great sound, easy to pair. A little tight over my ears, but not bad. This is the 3rd pair of Power Locus headphones I have purchased. The other 2 were bought like 6 or 7 years ago, and still have great sound. I just got these because I wanted noise canceling ones for my trip(because parents feel entitled to subject everyone around them to the noise of their minis),and also because I couldn't find replacement earpads for the other set.
These headphones produce excellent sound quality,,they are very comfortable to wear,, the design is simplistic which I appreciate,,, and they are very reasonably priced.

Worked wonderfully for the first few months. Charging stopped working about 3 months in (so no more Bluetooth features), then one of the headphone jacks got bent about 6 months in (still not entirely sure how, there was never any unreasonable force applied to it), and then the sound finally stopped working for good 7 months in. All in all, a lifespan of just over half a year.

Summary: sound quality was really nice while it lasted, connecting with devices was easy, the sound cancelation was really just sound muffling, and it was incredibly easy to break.

UPDATE: customer service reached out and sent me a free replacement, which was incredibly generous. So far, the new ones work great, although they act a bit differently than the old ones. I think these headphones just vary a lot.

With so many different options to chose from, I could not be happier with these wireless headphones! They come with a wire if needed and a great storage case but they were quite easy to set up as wireless headphones which I paired with my phone. The quality of the headphones themselves is great as well as the sound quality! The headphones expand to fit everyone in my family and the soft memory foam ear cups are really comfortable. I love the options in color and ordered the rose gold option. Great price for a great product!
They effectively cancel out the noise of the dryer and the fishtank filter, but can't compete with the noise of three kids making airplane noises.
We love these. They hold a charge a long time and have a great sound.

I bought these for my husband to use while mowing. He had tried several other brands and they didn’t drown out the lawn mower as well as these did. However, when he was finished mowing and went to turn them off, the music would not stop. It continued playing until they went dead, even with the switch turned to the off side. We ended up returning.
Great as both wireless or plugin
Acheté pour mon copain, il l’adore.

Ik heb er zeer kort van genoten. Binnen een paar dagen ging hij kapot. Garantie was voorbij..
Voor dat geld kun je hem beter laten liggen. Kost je alleen geld en tranen.

Laten liggen dus! 😭😭😭
Great product

Ich bin wirklich überrascht, wie viel Qualität man hier für sehr wenig Geld bekommt. Gerade wenn man im Zug unterwegs ist werden die Umgebungs-Geräusche super reduziert. Klang ist ganz OK. Sie sind auch super bequem. Ich würde diese Kopfhörer nur weiterempfehlen!
These are really great to use especially in the gym! They last so long without needed to charge them also! Great product and great for the price!

item51.description:
Item Package Dimension: 8.30L x 8.02W x 3.61H inches
Item Package Weight - 1.62 Pounds
Item Package Quantity - 1
Product Type - HEADPHONES
reviews: Best headset I have ever owned. The bass is so loud, I drown out everything at the gym. Superb.

I do a lot of grocery shopping for my job and these have been amazing! Cancels the noises around me while I enjoy my music so I can focus.
Also easy to answer an incoming call with one button push and callers have said they can hear me great while in a busy public place.
The best part: The charge lasts so long. I Use them for a couple hours at a time nearly every day and haven’t had to charge in weeks!
Adjustable fit works well for me. My only complaint is my face gets a bit sweaty from the cushion material and it occasionally pulls my hair, but I imagine any similar product would probably do the same. Oh and the color is nice too. Worthy investment!

The sound is amazing and my daughter loves the vibration of the bass. I have to say, I am totally impressed with these headphones. I bought them for my daughter and after using them am so jealous of how great they sound that I want to get a pair for myself. They are super stylish and just feel like quality. The sound is amazing, the 40 hours of charge time is ridiculous, and they are super comfortable. Phone calls are awesome and I especially love that you can use them with an included wired jack. Great for the PS4. Oh, and the carrying case is super sweet too. Way worth the price.

Updated since I first reviewed:
After having these for a few weeks I need to do another review. The sound overall is good, but the bass sometimes is just too much and gets distorted if set too high. It reminds me of when a subwoofer in the back of a car gives so much bass it can just distort the sound.

Also I am very annoyed that every single time I turn on my laptop I have to reset the bluetooth and pair it with the device. It's annoying to have to do this every time I want to use them.
Today it was so frustrating that it took nearly 1 hour of trying to pair them with my laptop all over again. They just won't pair with my laptop anymore. I've tried everything. Unfortunately I have travelled out of the country and the cost to send these back as a return before the return date is too expensive.
So I will just deal with them. Now they are only connecting by bluetooth to my phone. so I will have to use a cord to connect with the laptop.

First Review:
The headphones are very comfortable and the sound has been great for me so far. I use them to watch movies on my laptop or on my phone. Also when editing video content in Adobe Premier or using apps on my phone.
Noise cancellation is not perfect. I still hear sounds.

My biggest issue is the Bluetooth doesn't stay connected to devices I have already paired it with. I am always having to pair it all over again after I haven't used it for a few hours or a couple of days. My old headphones which were a cheap $20 pair never had this issue with pairing.
I love the color. They are easy to use, with only three buttons - power, volume up, and volume down. Adjustable and comfortable. My music gets loud with these! Good quality too.

This my second pair I’ve bought.
Love these headphones, that bass just hits.
I decided to get these for my brother since his old ones stopped working and he loves them. Overall I'm really happy with my purchase!
You will not regret it everything is beautiful from the inside out as well as packing.
Excelente
Ich emfinde den Klang als großartig.
Great sound. Good looking. One of the best
Great product, prefer the black ones though.
Son los segundos de ese modelo que compro solo me faltan los blancos y los negros en verde olivo tmb se ven hermosos

Reduces pressure on ear help your kids to find a long-listen comfort and a in super soft pressure-relieving status. Foldable design make it easier to carry and save your space.
reviews: I purchased the headset for my son for an upcoming trip and it has been great. He is five and it was very comfortable for him. Be sure to charge for several hours before you connect to anything. The only thing is that the lights on the headset don't turn off while in use... so if you're on a plane at night it gets a little bright.

These are a good quality, especially for the price. We’ve had them for a couple months and have had no issues. My four year old breaks everything, immediately, and has not broken these. They connected right away to the kids’ Kindles and reconnect every time they’re turned on. No issues at all.

Great buy! My autistic son LOVES them & never wants to take them off! Very comfortable & I love the convenient volume control! Phenomenal battery life!! I love the light up feature! Helps remind me to turn them off when he not wearing them!
Update after 2 months of every day use; headband piece is starting to fall apart. Once they hit the floor on accident it broke but I still give 5 stars. Overall great buy!! Thankfully a little duck tape did the trick! He loves them too much!! :)

My 3.5-year-old son loves these headphones and they're great for long car or airplane rides (kids' shows can be maddening in a confined space). They work well, have amazing battery life, and the sound quality is good. I appreciate the decibel limit on it. It's nice not having to worry about my son accidentally damaging his hearing by cranking the volume up too high. The flashing colorful lights look great and make it fun for my son to wear the headphones. My only complaint is that the controls are a little hard to use because it's very difficult to see the symbols on the buttons. They are small and they're the same color as the body of the headphones around them. Making them a different/contrasting color or even making them back-lit would be a huge improvement and make them much easier to use. It's frustrating trying to figure out which button is which in the backseat of a dark car at night. Overall, however, they're a great product for the price.

My grandson loves these and I do, too! He loves to play games on my iPad and I don't like to hear the games - the head phones solved the problem. Also, great for watching a movie and not disturbing others!
Let's see how sturdy, but so far lightweight and cute. Just sometimes the led lights get annoying. My son loves it. Hopefully they last.

I bought these for my son for Christmas last year. I also bought a pink pair for my daughter…. My daughter’s still work and I’ve never had an issue out of them. My sons on the other hand only lasted about 6 months at best quality. After 6 months they started to not hold a charge very long, maybe 2 hours. I started to notice the lights being on while he was using them so I would turn the lights off. But then I found out about a month ago that the button to turn the lights off doesn’t work and when you press it, it makes a very bad screeching sound for a few seconds, like it’s trying to connect to a bluetooth. These head phones were really good, until they weren’t. And now I’m having to buy replacements.

I bought these for our grandson and they have been a Godsend! Anyone whose ever had to listen to the same shows 100 times in a row understands! I mean I love him but a person can only sing baby shark so many times! Anywho, the headphones connect very easily to his tablet via Bluetooth and will run for upwards of 6-8 hours on a single charge. We have had them now for about four months and we have had no problems.

reviews: These work great for road trips and stay charged a long time the sound isn't great but kids don't really notice.
My kids love them. They work great, very easy for Bluetooth connection.
Thin ish but still soft and soaked up wound drainage well

• The cushion dies not cushion, it is made by super thin material.

• Will hurt your head very painfully if you have glasses.

• Immediately began flashing once on, which caused an epileptic seizure. If you have photoepilepsy, please be extremely careful.

• Material is very cheap and flimsy. Not to mention uncomfortable.

I will be returning this product due to the issues above but also because the moment I got it on it not only flashed by had a horrendously loud static sound. When ipaore did, it still was static. I believe it is a malfunctioning product. The other negative comments are still the same.

Save yourself the need to return this item and pay 10-20 more dollars for a decent headset.
I bought this for my daughter for her birthday. Seeing her eyes light up in the mirror from how cool it is with all the lights and colors. Now she wants one in every color.
My daughter had never used head phones. She was excited to try it. She is very picky to place things on her head or ears. It was a quick transition.
Funciona muy bien y las luces se ve muy divertida a mi niña le encanto y dure mucho tiempo y no se descarga .
todo bien salvo un detalle de la decoracion, pero es pasable

item54.name: SONY Wireless Headphones for TV Watching (WHRF400R) with Transmitter Dock (TMRRF400) – 6-ft 3.5mm Stereo + NeeGo RCA Plug Y-Adapter
item54.description:
ALL-IN-ONE AUDIO HEADPHONE SET – Bundle Pack Includes HD Wireless Headset Transmitter/Charging Dock & BONUS Y-Adapter w/3 5mm Stereo & 2 NeeGo RCA Plugs
EASY WIRELESS CONNECTIVITY – Radio Frequency Headphones Let You Move Freely Up to 150 Ft Through Walls & Ceiling Battery Life Up to 20 Hours Per Charge
SENSATIONAL HD PERFORMANCE – Sony Technology Produces High Fidelity Sound & Booming Bass w/ Noise Reduction Voice Mode Volume Control & Auto Tune
OPTIMIZED FOR CINEMA – Durable Powerful 40mm Drivers Render Clear Warm Detailed Sound Dynamic Music & Crisp Dialogue for All Your Hi-Fi Entertainment
EXTREME COMFORT DESIGN – Soft Adjustable Over Ear Pads Provide a Secure Yet Lightweight Fit for Watching Movies Binging TV Playing Videogames & Beyond
reviews: We have an old TV and this worked really well. The ear pads are comfortable, the sound is great, especially for us with hearing problems.

I nearly returned these. The RCA audio jacks on my TV are input only. Using the 3.5mm audio out line works perfectly.

I noticed the sound cutting out now and then and it turns out that happens when I recline and the receiving antenna in the part of the headset that goes over my head can't see the transmit antenna. For some reason my head blocks the signal but I can walk all over my house and still hear. Works great. No notable delay or latency. I cancelled the return. I am glad I didn't return them.

It’s was really easy to set up but I learned I didn’t have the correct audio setting on my tv so I didn’t work immediately. Sounds better than my gaming headphones with less interference for about the same price. The sound is clear and goes up super loud which is good for me as I am hard of hearing. The range is awesome around my entire house. I wish it had a mute button but other than that I’m happy

2nd unit I’ve owned. Started having trouble with on switch on first pair after 2 years+ and headband needed electrical tape over some padding. 1st pair still mostly works. Bonus - both pair can be used simultaneously- but one set will not work if second is being charged on charger hooked to TV.

This was DOA out of the box. Tried everything and could not get it to work. Before getting it ready for it's return trip to Amazon, I tried substituting another mini-plug cable that I had laying around and , voila! It now works fine. So the supplied mini-plug cable was defective.

That issue resolved, this is really a pretty nice headphone setup. It was dead simple to set up. Installing the provided rechargeable battery into the headphones was a little tricky, but not a big deal. The sound quality is quite good - the "speech" setting boosts the treble a bit to make things a little easier to understand. The volume control on the headphone is a little tight to move, but I just left it a 5 and use the volume control on the TV which gives me all the range I need. Note that this will probably work only if you are using the headphone jack on the TV for the input. The headphones are pretty comfortable - not too much pressure on your ears, but still fit snugly enough to block out most outside noise. My only gripe is the indicator light on the charging base. It lights up red when the headphones are charging, but then extinguishes when the charge is complete. It would be nice if it would turn green to show a full charge.

I would give it 5 starts, but I'm deducting one star for a lax quality control that allowed my unit to ship with a defective mini-plug cable.

And speaking of cables, the vendor threw in a mini-plug to 2 RCA plug adapter cable that is not included in the Sony package. Just a nice little extra so there are enough provided audio cables to cover any setup your TV might have.

EDIT: Ended up having to return this to Amazon. It worked fine for 2 days and then went DOA again. I disconnected and reconnected everything and, again, it worked OK. Next day, DOA again. The problem has to be in the power supply or the audio cable to the TV, but I didn't feel like having to do more troubleshooting. Packed it up (glad I saved the box and packing) and sent it back to Amazon for a refund.
Good sound. Good battery life. Easy to get in the charger. Easy connection; just hit the auto connect button and they hook up.

The headphones were extremely easy to set up. They do a great job of being able to enjoy TV without having the TV turned up too loud for others. The biggest complaint is that while watching a show, there is a momentary drop in sound. Sometimes it goes days without the issue and then some days it might drop 4 or 5 times during a show. Just simply turning my head seems to resolve the problem so not sure if it is a signal problem or a malfuction. Other than that, I really enjoy the ability to watch a show and be able to hear it without it being too loud for my wife. I haven't gotten used to the location of the volume button to adjust the volume without having to take the headphones off but I'm sure I will get used to thatl.
good quality

Excelente producto, buena definición de sonido, aísla muy bien los ruidos ambientales mientras se escucha la musica, pienso que algunas fallas que se reportan pueden deberse a que no siguen las instrucciones para la primera carga, yo lo deje cargando las horas que recomiendan y no me ha dado ningún problema, el único defecto que le pongo es que lleven las conexiones de carga en la diadema, ya que puede ser que teniendo el cabello húmedo, sea por agua o sudor esto podría provocar que las baterías se descarguen más rápidamente, fuera de eso los auriculares son muy cómodos, con un buen alcance, aunque no he hecho la prueba para ver cual es su alcance máximo. Estoy muy satisfecho de haberlos adquirido.
Muy buena calidad de sonido, cómodos y funcionan excelente
Los cables RCA solo viene el conector en su color rojo y blanco. Nunca ha venido en el color negro de conexión. Deberían de retomar la foto de lo que incluye,porque puede decepcionar a otros.
Todo bien

LOS AUDIFONOS NO SUENAN BIEN, TIENEN UN SONIDO DIRIGIDO A LAS FRECUENCIAS MEDIAS, SIN BAJOS Y UN SONIDO TIPO FRECUENCIA DE RADIO AM, LO PEOR TENIA UNA INTERFERENCIA (ESTANDO A TRES METROS DE DISTANCIA) QUE NO SE QUITABA, HICE EL CAMBIO DE CANALES BUSCANDO EL MAS OPTIMO PERO NUNCA SE QUITÓ ESE RUIDO, A 15 METROS EL RUIDO SEGUIA EXACTAMENTE IGUAL, LO PEOR ES QUE A ESA DISTANCIA EMPEZÓ EN A PERDERSE LA SEÑAL EN INTERVALOS DE UNO O DOS SEGUNDOS Y TAMPOCO CAMBIANDO LOS CANALES SE PUDO SOLUCIONAR.
TENGO UNOS sony mdr rf800r QUE COMPRÉ EN EL AÑO 2007 Y EL BOTON DE SELECTOR DE CANALES DE LA BASE YA NO FUNCIONA BIEN, SUPONGO POR EL USO Y LOS AÑOS Y EL BOTON DE CAMBIO DE CANAL EN EL AUDIFONO TAMBIEN ESTA FALLANDO, ASI QUE POR ESO DECIDI CAMBIARLOS.
LA CALIDAD DE SONIDO DE MIS sony mdr rf800r ES ABSOLUTAMENTE MEJOR Y SIN PROBLEMAS DE RUIDO CUANDO FUNCIONABAN BIEN LOS CANALES. ASI QUE TUVE QUE REGRESARLE A LA TIENDA LOS AUDIFONOS Sony WHRF400R, ES LAMENTABLE LA CALIDAD Y EL MAL SONIDO DE ESTOS AUDIFONOS Y LA INTERFERENCIA, EN MI CASO NO LOS RECOMIENDO POR LA CALIDAD Y LOS PROBLEMAS QUE TUVE DE RUIDO.

The earcups are made of thick sponge for strong sound insulation and pillow-like softness when listening.
Rubber-feel paint, more comfortable to the touch. Thick protein ear cushions mimic the texture of human skin, breathable and durable. Adjustable sliders and padded headband provide maximum comfort. Ergonomic design that perfectly fits everyone's head and ears, the headphones are equipped with adjustable head hands and padded ear cushions; In addition, it is very light and does not burden your head.
5.0 Bluetooth Connectivity: Designed to provide a fast and stable Bluetooth connection and can be paired with two devices at the same time and seamlessly switched between them – meaning you can quickly switch from listening to a playlist on your phone to having a conference call on your laptop. Wireless Bluetooth headset is compatible with all Bluetooth-enabled devices such as smartphones, tablets, laptops, iPads, MP3/4 players, Compuer, MacBook, and other Bluetooth devices.
Wired and wireless 25-hour playtime: High-capacity rechargeable batteries provide up to 25 hours of playtime in wireless mode. Provides a 3.5 audio cable that never turns off the listening power. Headphones 3 hours fast charging. You can switch between wired mode or wireless mode freely without interruption. You don't need to worry about power shortages for long trips. In addition to 12/7 customer support, you get a 12-month warranty and 100% customer satisfaction.
reviews:
- Sound with music sources is generally pretty good, especially for the price point. Very clear left-right separation, good bass, and overall decent quality. A little muddy at times particularly in the mid-range, but generally pleasant.
- Sound with voice sources is more than sufficient.
- Sound with games is also more than sufficient, again due to go left right separation, decent bass, and enough clarity across the frequency range that normal gaming sounds are clear and identifiable.
- Microphone has gotten generally low marks from people on phone calls and online meetings - its been described as muffled and sounding like I'm down a long hallway from the other person.
- Bluetooth - lost a star here, specifically for the lack of being able to put it in pairing mode if its already talking to another device. In general pairing was quick. It does need to be disconnected from one source in my experience before it will connect with another (i.e. I had to force-disconnect it from my laptop before I could search for and connect it to my phone). There appears to be no way from the headset it self to force it into paring mode if it is actively paired with a device. Bluetooth range actually seemed better than my go-to's from a sound perspective - I could be a couple of rooms away from the source and still hear clearly (sometimes my galaxy buds will drop the connection from the same location).
- Fit and finish is reasonable for the price point - buttons are clearly labeled have a solid click to them. The power / play buttton isn't completely flush with the outside shell of the headphone, but not a big deal. They are a little stiff right out of the box and they are on-the-ear, so a little more pressure on the ears initially. I expect they will wear in over time.
- Overall these seem like a really good value option - not highly recommended if your main use is for voice, but otherwise a good pair of relatively inexpensive bluetooth headphones suitable for sound in gaming as well as watching videos / listening to audio.

FWIW My go to's generally are Bose QC30's (almost 10 years old) and Galaxy Buds II for reference, so I'm reviewing this based on the price point, not as a comparison to my main headsets.

My son recently told me that he was being bullied on the bus ride home. That seriously triggered me because some kids... they're just mean. So I've been strategizing on how to keep my son busy on the Middle School bus ride and one of our ideas was to get him headphones so he could just ignore the kids and hopefully, they'll leave him alone. I ordered these headphones for just that purpose. Came in great, sturdy packaging (really nice quality on the materials). The headphones fit him perfectly (12yo boy, plays football - not small). The ear pieces fold in for storage and snap into place easily. It charged overnight and he was able to use it for a full week (to/from school) without having to recharge it. The ride to school is about 20 mins each way. Connected with no issues with his iPhone SE. Has helped so far with the idiots that are bullying him on the bus - will update if the headphones break. So far, so good. Great quality for the price. Even if he gets a few months out of them and they get crushed, I would buy again.

I liked some things about these headsets, primarly that they are small and light to wear. If you have blue tooth connection to a phone or a TV, it isn't difficult to connect. However, be aware if you have paired to a phone and then try something else and your phone is in range, it won't drop the phone and go to the new item. Unpair the phone then you can pair to your TV or other blue tooth device.

The sound is fine, but if you are an audio expert this won't be the headset for you. If you want a low cost, unit for yourself or a child, it should be adequate.

Instructions: There are some language issues in the instructions as it was obviously a translation. The printed instructions are very very small type and are somewhat skimpy. With some testing and trying I was able to get some things to work as expected when connected to my TV, but it was not easy to figure out for each different connection I tried.

I found that the micro data card is probably not going to be useful for most users as it uses, not a regular micro SD card, but a micro TF card of only 16 gigs. Apparently a TF card is NOT as SD card. I don't have a TF card so I couldn't test it, but it will physcially accept an SD card, but not read it. Therefore unless you have TF cards of 16 gigs or less, that item is of no value.

Most mobile phones no longer have a direct audio plug, but I found that my husband's Samsung S10 does have one and music will play from that phone to the headset. The track changing did not work, nor the volume using the wired connection.

I found to make the volume work you must hold the track/volume (+or _) button down. Then the volume on my Samsung TV did work through the headset. It would not work with the S10 through the wired connection, but does work with the bluetooth connection on my S22 phone.

In summary if you are looking for feature laden, high end sound, you need a different product. This is a nice low cost over the ear for TV watching or listening to sound on your phone.

reviews: I purchased two of the wireless headsets for my 6yo and 4yo and they work perfectly. The headsets are adjustable for bigger or smaller sized heads and sit comfortably. The volume settings are great for little ones and I don’t have to worry about the volume getting too loud for their little ears. Very skeptical to purchase this given the low price. These are so comparable to brand name headphones like Beats Solo’s. Perfect for kids or adults. Bluetooth paired so quickly and easily. The sound is so clear with no skips or static sound with great base as well. The colors are so fun and my kids love them ! 10/10 recommended to purchase.

My kids love these. They use them in the car on long trips and they work great. The battery life is long enough for them and they fit comfortably on my kids. The color is cute and they’re easy enough to use that my kids can manage them on their own without much help.

These just arrived. Look great. I purchased on prime day. What sold me is that they were advertised as unbreakable for kids! The ad picture show the headphones being twisted.
That is what I wanted.
This morning I received an email stating the headphone were not unbreakable, and I could purchase ( for an additional cost)
a replacement warranty.
I was very disappointed.
I tried twisting the headphones as in the pictured ad. I would have broken them.
Fair warning to anyone who purchases these for kids.

These headphones work great and my grandkids love them. They connect easily to Bluetooth, and stay connected. Durable and lightweight. Highly recommend for kids and tablets or tv…..cuts down on noise in living room, with so much going on.
My son enjoyed using them during our 18 hour flight. They look cool and have the noise cancel effect
Daughter loves them. Comfortable to wear on roads trips. Uses it when watching shows on her tablet

These are a great affordable option for children. I got them for my 2 and 4 year olds to use with their tablets.
The colors are fun and price can’t be beat. However, I must say that quality is fairly low. These are perfect for travel and occasional use but will not hold up in regular rotation.
