reviews: They are comfortable with good sound. I recommend this one.

These are these are the most comfortable headphones I've ever worn, and they are also the first bluetooth pair I've owned--so I don't have much basis for comparison. I like these headphones, and I think I'll get a lot of use out of them, but there are a few problems. The first was the directions, which are not at all clear. (See attached photograph). Fortunately, even for someone who hasn't done this before, it was pretty straightforward to turn on bluetooth on my laptop and my phone and connect the device. The headphones tell you when they are pairing and when they're connected. I think you can only connect to one device at a time. I had to disconnect from my laptop before the headphones would show up as an available device on my phone. For me, that's no problem because I will probably only use them with my laptop.

The sound quality when listening to YouTube videos on my laptop was good. I was happy with it. It was equally good when listening to a video on my phone. However, the sound when making a call is a bit muddy, for both caller and callee. I could easily understand what my interlocutor was saying (and he could understand me), but the sound quality wasn't clear.

Concerning the range, I could continue listening up to about 40 feet away if there were no walls between me and my laptop, but when I was in the next room, the sound cut out about 20 feet away. If there were two walls (even with open doors) between me and the laptop, I could not get a connection.

Finally, a word about the controls. They are located on the back of the right headphone. I had to take off the headphones to use them, but I suppose when I'm used to it, I'll be able to use the controls by touch alone. Concerning the features of the device, it was easy to figure out how to pause and how to move from one track to the next (I did this using a YouTube play list). Also, if you are listening to a video and you get a phone call, it is pretty easy to switch to the call (just press the center button). However, I could not figure out how to use the FM mode to search for FM stations. I followed the directions provided, but all I succeeded in doing was skipping from one track to the next on the YouTube playlist. I could not figure out how to change from bluetooth mode to FM mode even after I disconnected the device from my phone and laptop.

Anyway, for comfort and sound quality in everything but phone calls, these worked very well, 5/5 but for phone call sound quality and the unclear directions, I'd give them a 3/5. Hence my overall rating is 4/5. However, if, like me, you just want some reasonably priced headphones you can use to listen to music or play videos, you'd be happy with these, especially as they are super comfortable.

Before anything else: these headphones will accept a micro-sd card! I've never seen this feature before - at any price - and sets these apart. Going to the gym or washing our car or anywhere else where you don't want to bring your $1,000 cellphone? Just load up the micro-sd card and you don't need another device. Its like having an ipod built into the headphones, and I didn't see this mentioned in other reviews.

The headphones are light but not cheap feeling - they weight about the same as a more expensive Phillips pair. The power-sliding button IS cheap feeling but it works without issue. The other buttons aren't remarkable - they don't feel overly cheap nor premium. Call quality is good enough.

They are very comfortable on your ears and the padding is surprisingly soft - both the foam filling and the faux leather covers (see image 2).

I tested these headphones against 3 other pairs: a $10 pair from Monoprice (center); a $100+ pair from Phillips (right), and my a pair of DT 990 PRO 250ohm from Beyerdynamic.

They sound much better than, and are much more comfortable than the $10 pair.
They are not as comfortable, don't form as good of a "seal" around your ears, aren't as noise isolating (with noise canceling off) and don't sound as clear as the $100 pair.
The Beyerdynamic's are wired, open-back headphones that need a decently powerful amp to drive them... so these headphones cannot match them.

So they're better than the $10 pair, and worse than the $100 pair... great review right? They are easily worth $10 more than the cheap pair -- just based on the audio quality and comfort and build quality. I don't really think the $100 pair is worth $80 dollars more than these SLOSAP headphones --- for most people. The SLOSAP's sound good: they are bass-heavy like all headphones in this category, but they sound good. They are clear. They obviously don't have the best fidelity/clarity/response range... but they are $20 headphones and if you aren't familiar with those terms you don't need to worry about it.

They sound really good. For $20 you cannot go wrong. I've been wearing them daily and will use them when doing things like mowing the lawn or going to the gym or just in the office - where I need something lightweight and comfortable, but don't need the sound to be 100% accurate.

reviews: Perfect for my work headset. Simple to put together
It’s very durable and secure! It’s a great size for my Beats Solo 3s. Easy to assemble. Love it!

This stand is okay, the tube is aluminum and so you would hope the base would be too, but it's not, it's plastic. I've bumped the stand a couple of times and it falls over easily. I wish the base was aluminum or something else a little heavier or maybe wider. The price is good.
This is a simple holder that does the job! Hold the headphones perfect. Sturdy and well made!

Most headphone stands have some weighting in the bottom to keep them stable while you are placing or removing the headphones. This stand, however, does not. The base is just a very thin and light piece of plastic. It makes the stand top-heavy, and it is impossible to take the headphones off the stand or put them on it without the stand falling over because it is so unstable.

Also, the base has an ugly logo on it that is not shown in the pictures on the product listing. I was able to mostly remove it using some rubber alcohol and hard scrubbing, but this still left a trace outline of the logo I could not remove. I do not like that it has that logo and they mislead by omitting it from the product images.

This is a very simple, functional and super sleek design for a headphone stand. Always tired of setting my headphones on top of my laptop, on the side of the desk, on the printer, wherever. It takes up less room than it would by just setting your headphones on the desk/table, and it makes the space look much more organized.

I bought this headphone stand thinking it would be heavier and of better quality, but I was wrong. The base is made from a cheap plastic and the stand is really lightweight.

I gave it 3 stars because it does work. For the utility of holding my Sony Headphones, it does work and I cannot complain about a product that does what is described.

For the price, it is a good deal too. You are getting what you pay for it.

Overall, I would recommend if you need a simple headphone stand... but I personally will be looking elsewhere for a sturdier stand with a stronger base and smaller logo.
This holds my headset very nicely. it has a compact base that slots in to a decently small space. It doesn't wobble or tip. It looks modern and sleek.

reviews: These headphones are comfortable to wear over my hearing aids. The openings are large enough that they don't put pressure on my ears or the aids. The sound is very good for listening to the TV when the rest of the family are sleeping and I need it quiet. Thank you for this great product.

I find these headphones to be very comfortable to wear for extended periods of time, usually about 1 to 2 hours for training in the office. They have a pad on the inside of the head strap that makes them more comfortable to wear than some I have had without the padding, just a plastic strap that irritates eventually. The headphones have a nice charging base that they sit into which also helps keep the headphones stowed and easy to find for the next use. The charging base is also the transmitter that has to be connected to the source device by a headphone jack or a Red/White-RCA jack. I would have given it 5 stars if it was Bluetooth compatible. Another thing to consider is that some newer smart TV's do not have either of these outputs available, my Samsung 60" TV does not, so I would not be able to use these headphones with my TV if I wanted to. But, that said, it does work good with my computers, laptop and IPad. The headphones come with an understandable instruction book that explains and pictures the connections, operation and troubleshooting very well. Connection and first use were extremely easy and trouble free. Overall I am pleased with the quality and ease of use and comfort of these headphones.
My TV has an optical cable only, this unit only works on rca jacks

Why Did the delivery driver leave my package outside of the post office doorway when it was open for business and a post office customer delivered it the the post office clerk inside !!!! That a lie kevin Davis never signed for package !!!
Good quality head phones. Sound and volume both are quite goid

I really like these headphones. I hooked them up to my computer via RCA to
headphone jack cable included and I have to say I love the range. These are not
Bluetooth, they are like the old wireless home phones so the range is way better. I
am able to go outside on the porch and still listen to my videos playing inside. I also
love the look and feel of the headphones themself. They feel well made and I like
the way they sit in the charging stand when not in use. I no longer have wires all
across my desk.

One thing about them that is kind of annoying is that they listen for sound coming from
the source audio and if they don't hear anything for a while, they shut down. This is to conserve
battery life and it's a good thing, but I found it caused them to drop out from time to
time when listening to an audiobook or something with no background noise. When
the speaker pauses for too long, it thinks there is no audio.

The only other thing I didn't like about these were the cables that come with them. Basically, they sent the cheapest cables they could find, they didn't
make good contact when connecting so there is some signal loss and noise generated from the subpar cables.
Ease of set up. Very comfortable. Recommend

I really enjoy this wireless TV headset. I’ve used it for two weeks now, and can honestly say... it’s pretty good.

The sound quality is good, but not perfect. I can clearly hear my TV, and there hasn’t been a delay with the sound (when the voices don’t match the actors mouth). The charging stand is made of a light plastic and utilizes RCA cables, and those cables connect to the TV’s RCA ports. The headphones are comfortable enough to wear long term, and I haven’t had a headache from them... yet. The pads are soft and the volume can get loud; there is one single issue they have....

The volume dial is barely usable. At any higher point than low to medium-low is a constant static. This static is unbearable and ruins the experience. This, which sounds like a huge burden, doesn’t affect my rating. Within 5 minutes I discovered the solution; turn up the TV’s volume and only use the dial on the wireless headphones for slight changes.

Pausing a show and returning will turn off the headphones, a kind of sleep mode. This preserves battery life, and all you need to do is remember to turn them back on. I don’t consider this an issue.

My rating is based on the products ability to deliver an experience that I needed. I work until late, and into the early morning. Going to bed at daybreak means keeping the noise down so I don’t wake anyone up. This headset has allowed me to watch TV again and I’d recommend it for anyone in my situation. I’ll continue using it, flaws aside, because it fulfills a need.

item62.name: 1MORE SonoFlow SE Active Noise Cancelling Wireless Headphones, Over Ear Bluetooth Headphones with DLC Dynamic Driver, 70H Playtime, Clear Calls, Custom EQ via app
item62.description:
Immersive Sound Performance: 1MORE Sonoflow SE headphones embrace remarkable sound clarity and enhanced bass with the 1MORE cutting-edge 40mm diamond-like-carbon DLC dynamic driver, delivering immersive audio and setting new standards for premium sound quality.
Advanced  Noise-Cancelling Technology: 1MORE QuietMax innovative noise-cancelling tech effectively blocks noise in wider and deeper frequency ranges, delivering unparalleled focus and clarity to your music and calls.
70-Hour Playtime: Unleash the freedom of extended power with an impressive 70-hour playback time of the 1MORE SonoFlow SE. And charging it for 5mins ensures 5 hour of listening.
Enhanced Calling: Experience pristine call quality with 1MORE Bluetooth headphones featuring an AI-driven noise reduction tech that significantly reduces background noise, ensuring seamless and undisturbed conversations.
Ultimate Comfort: Experience long time comfort with skin-friendly protein leather ear cups and a customizable headband that ensures a perfect fit.
reviews: Lifelong audiophile. I work in radio, podcasting and music production. Crystal clear sound quality. Almost Bose level. ANC is great too. I can't recommend these enough! If these are in your cart, and you're nervous... don't be. You'll love them. They sound almost identical to Airpods Max or Sony WX5000 or whatever they're called.

The sound quality with these is great the bass is amazing, the noise cancelling works really well for background noise (and that’s coming from an autistic adult with sensory issues) they are pretty comfy and they don’t fall off my head or squeeze too hard, the controls were a little confusing at first bc the instructions aren’t clear but just look up a video on YouTube to help you and it works great. My only complaint is that every once and a while the sound will cut out for like half a second, I can’t figure out why it’s not often enough to bother me too much but it is kinda annoying. Please let me know if there’s any way I can fix this. Other than that great headphones for the price

These bargain headphones go way past my expectations. I bought them for traveling as an alternative to earbuds that get uncomfortable on long flights. The sound is way better than I expected and they are light and comfortable. However, the noise cancelation is astounding. I'm in my own world. On two flights, the attendant had to flag me to put up the seat and window shade for landing. I didn't hear a thing. This was in and out of Europe where people are polite. So I'm sure they were trying for some time without being disruptive. So funny to me, it's worth making this review.

Bargain brands like this really deliver.

So what are the differences between the SE and non SE Sonoflow? Only thing I can tell is that LDAC is not a feature in the SE and some minor cosmetic changes. ANC seems the same, which puts it in-between Soundcore Q35 and Soundcore Space in effectiveness, overall slightly above average for this price point. Great buy at under $50.

They are near perfect, the mic isn’t great and it lacks a 3.5mm jack but personally I didn’t care about that. This headset overall though for music and content in general are 1000% better than expected, these sound better than my computer headphones pushing 32bit audio, they sound cleaner and more crisp, the battery life is next level. I don’t use them every day but I just charged them for the first time last week, that’s over a month and a half without a charge. Good work 1more top notch.

They have the best sound out of any headphone or bud for me. The only complaint I have is my outer ears get sore. And they are not sweet proof. If those things were correct you wouldn’t be able to buy a better set. You can’t sound wise. And I say that having a set of Bose the sound and bass quality is 0 to none. I listen to them 5-8 hours a day every day. Until I start to sweat 😓. But the are truly a awesome set. And we’ll worth the money bar none
I am not a audiophile but graduating in 69, most of what I listen to is Rock! I.listen to a little Josh Groban, Enya, etc. Anyway you will not be disappointed with phones. Its a promise.
Head phones will no pair ,customer service providers provide nothing in help …

En definitiva los mejores.

No tienen nada que envidiarle a la marca Sony, etc.(si no eres un audiofilo). Estos audifonos te seran muy utiles, yo los uso para estudiar y me ayuda a concentrarme. Aunque no se si a alguien mas le marea la cancelacion de ruido, jaja, supongo que es cosa de acostumbrarse

Points forts :

Son excellent
Réduction de bruit efficace
Mode transparence excellent
Confortable à porter

Points faibles :

Construction en plastique

Je viens d'acheter le casque 1More Sonoflow SE pour un total de 75 dollars canadiens. Dans cette gamme de prix, je trouve qu'il est imbattable que ce soit au niveau du son, de la réduction de bruit ou du mode transparence.

Son

Le son du Sonoflow SE est excellent.
J'ai écouté une variété de genres musicaux avec le Sonoflow SE, et j'ai été impressionné par la qualité du son. Les basses sont profondes et puissantes, les médiums sont clairs et les aigus sont bien définis. Le casque offre une bonne scène sonore, ce qui permet de profiter pleinement de la musique.

Réduction de bruit

La réduction de bruit du Sonoflow SE est également très efficace. Elle permet de bloquer la plupart des bruits ambiants, ce qui est idéal pour écouter de la musique ou travailler dans un environnement bruyant.

J'ai testé la réduction de bruit du Sonoflow SE dans une variété d'environnements, et elle a toujours été efficace pour bloquer les bruits ambiants. J'ai pu écouter ma musique en paix, même dans un environnement bruyant.

Mode transparence

Le mode transparence du Sonoflow SE est également très bon. Il permet d'entendre les bruits ambiants sans avoir à retirer le casque. C'est pratique pour parler à quelqu'un ou pour être conscient de son environnement.

Construction

La construction du Sonoflow SE est en plastique, mais elle est solide et durable. Le casque est également très confortable à porter, même sur de longues périodes.

Le casque est léger et s'adapte bien à la tête. Les coussinets d'oreille sont rembourrés et confortables. J'ai pu porter le casque pendant plusieurs heures sans avoir mal aux oreilles.

Boutons

Les boutons du Sonoflow SE sont bien placés et faciles à utiliser. Ils offrent un bon retour haptique.

Les boutons sont situés sur les oreillettes et sont faciles à trouver et à utiliser. Ils permettent de contrôler la lecture de musique, les appels téléphoniques et la réduction de bruit.

Conclusion

Le 1More Sonoflow SE est un excellent casque sans fil dans sa gamme de prix. Il offre un son excellent, une réduction de bruit efficace et un mode transparence bien fait. Si vous recherchez un casque sans fil à un prix abordable, je vous le recommande vivement.

Dobry ANC, dobry dźwięk, ale bez szału, trochę metaliczny, rozdzielczość i detaliczność tylko przyzwoita, ale dobra jak na tą cenę. Właściwie trudno mieć jakiekolwiek zastrzeżenia przy tej cenie słuchawek.
Oczywiście są one zdecydowanie gorsze niż Audio Technica ATH-ANC900BT czy Sennheiser Momentum 4 (choć ANC jest na podobnym, a może nawet lepszym poziomie).

J'ai été agréablement surpris par la qualité générale de ce casque !
Sa fonction anti bruit est largement suffisante en usage "normal" et le son est vraiment correct.
Il est très bien construit et semble plutôt durable.
A cela ajouter une grande autonomie, un temps de charge relativement court et un port confortable.
J'ai déjà possédé des casques beaucoup beaucoup plus chers et qui n'étaient pas meilleurs pour autant.
Pas du tout déçu de cette acquisition.

For the price, these do really good noise cancelling. My neighbours loud music is so much quieter with the noise cancelling on. I'm so impressed considering the price. I'm no audiophile but I feel like the sound is pretty good too and you can also change levels in their app if you're more picky

item63.name: Skullcandy Riff On-Ear Wired Headphones, Microphone, Works with Bluetooth Devices and Computers - Black
item63.description:
Refined acoustics - Riff is engineered to deliver exceptional sound quality at an affordable price.
Microphone with call and track control - Riff lets you manage calls and tracks with buttons on the ear cups.
Comfortability at its finest - Riff's light-weight, ultra durable headband and plush on-ear cushions delivers unparalleled comfort.
Travel-ready - A collapsible, flat-folding design makes the Riff easy to pack and use anywhere on-the-go.
Buy with Confidence - 1 year US warranty included.
reviews: I love everything about these headphones, especially the color but mostly the sound. I listen to a lot of dubstep and other heavy bass music and these are not only comfy for long periods but sound great, 9 out of 10. 9 because they feel sort of flimsy and could break if I'm careless. I have Bluetooth earbuds that sound great too, but I don't like using them all the time like I do these.
Very thicc earpads, but can feel pain for prolonged use probably since this is my first on ear. Weird build quality as there are 5 different plastic finishing but don't feel cheap. Decent sound.

They sound as great as you might expect from Skull Candy earphones. I find on-ear headphones to be more comfortable than over ear headphones. So, I think these are comfortable. The midrange is scooped giving a pleasing bass and treble response. They're kind of flimsy though and the cord is only 4 ft long.

For the price these are excellent headphones and a worthy candidate for "daily driver." For me, these are computer/desk headphones. That is my use and that is probably how you should plan on using them as well. The cushions are very soft but the fit itself is on the firm side. Because the cushions are soft, they are nice and comfortable. Because the cushions are soft I'd be hesitant about getting too much sweat in them at the gym. They won't fall off-- that's not the issue-- but I'm guessing you don't want to get the cushions wet. Are they durable? They sit at my desk. I thought about stuffing them in a "getting too full" backpack for a flight recently and I declined to do so. If you are really going to be putting them into very full bags maybe see if you can handle a pair in the store before making a decision. On the desk? As long as you aren't yanking these things off you should be fine.

Sound review? This is hard because there is so much that goes into it. I'll give it a shot. I can't talk about leakage because I'm not usually around people when these are on. There is no noise cancelling but the fit and the pads do an okay job of getting rid of a lot of background noise. These replaced some Koss Porta-Pros and some old Sol headphones as my main laptop headphones. (That's where I do most of my work.) So yes, I'm running off a laptop. No fancy power sources. They can get nice and loud and not bring in any distortion. That's good. I guess these are probably "somewhat warm" sounding headphones. I listen to some vaporwave and a lot of metal (black/thrash and such) so I think I cover the need to hear all levels and ranges of sound and don't have a need to focus on one aspect over the other but I guess the elephant in the room is always bass? It handles bass pretty well. It isn't an overly aggressive bass sound but you can hear it nicely and distinctly. There is some punch to the bass but, to be sure, it isn't at the level of beats headphones (and I like beats, but they are also a lot more money). Listening to some of the raw metal recordings, the bass is nice and it handles the distortion and rawness of metal tracks very well. So, the bass is good to the extent that the headphones generally maintain a consistent and clear sound-profile. And there is clearly more bass than more clear or neutral sounding headphones. It isn't necessarily a bass heavy headphone but it is definitely bass capable. I can make the volume louder or softer without introducing any more distortion and I don't have to listen to it loudly to "hear" the music.

These are very good headphones for the price. The four stars is because the headphone market is brutal and these are four star headphones, especially for the price. They are not magic value headphones that you would/could pay +$150 for, or something like that. That is, in my mind, going in to five star territory. For the price you will probably pay for these on this site, you are getting a really great pair of daily drivers and they are easy to recommend. I'm considering getting the (a) blue-tooth version of these.

Also nice that they can connect to your phone to play music.

Jokes aside, for the price point it is hard to beat the comfort, sound quality, and battery life here. I see a lot of people complaining about the “plastic-y” feeling but these are not $200+ headphones, and if you are expecting headphones that have better build then you are in the wrong price bracket. I will also mention these are the second set I owned. The previous model I had for 3+ years. These look and feel just about the same but with better battery. The durability is just fine

as per usual, skullcandy never disappoints. i've sworn by the jib series of earbuds for years and these headphones are just as high-quality as the in-ears. much like the jib headphones, they're nice with the high-end but a little on the heavier side with low end. that's not at all a minus for me. reminds me of the "mega bass" sony had for a while. the low end is not offensive at all but rather pleasant and fairly transparent.
the cherry-on-top with these phones is the power they can handle. again, much like the jib earbuds, these phones can handle pretty much as much juice as your device is able to throw at it with no distortion. a phone won't crank too much but i also tested them with a headphone amplifier and they blast!
these headphones don't have any noise-cancelling system but i generally avoid that anyway. they're also not very quiet externally so if you're blasting music, everyone around you will hear it, too. that may be a con for some but i only use these at home so no biggie.
the only drawback for me is that they're a little smaller than i expected (hand in the pic for scale reference), but that's not at all a design flaw and not anything to bring it down from five stars.
these headphones are great not just for the price but ESPECIALLY for the price. they perform every bit as well as anything you'd find in the $50-$100 range. if you're looking for something for studio use, these are not for you as they're made to sound good, not flat. but if you want to rattle your brain with clear, defined boomy sound, these are the ones!
I like the sound quality for audio recording and listening. Unfortunately, you get what you pay for - and the headband is flimsy and easily cracks and breaks. I won't be buying these again.

Very practical. They are nice when I don't want to hear noise around me. Quality is good. They can connect to 2 devices at once which is pretty cool. Super quick and easy to go back and forth between my computer and phone.
Gran sonido totalmente original
Muy buen producto por el sonido. Lo uso con mp3 principalmente. Un poco frágiles solamente. Cómodos muchísimo. Me encantaron. Y el precio es muy bueno. Gran ganga!

I was reluctant to buy these due to a lot of reviews saying that the plastic headband is prone to breaking. I figured I'd give them a try anyways, and if they broke, well, then those people were right. Turns out that's not the case though!

I have been using these for 14 months now, DAILY, because I work from home, and they are still looking and working like brand new. I take them off and put them on easily 20-30 times a day. Sure, I've been gentle with them when taking them off/putting them on and hanging them on my desk, but I think everybody should take some care when doing that anyways.

Pros:
- Ear pads are SUPER soft and cushiony (also a con, read below).
- Sound quality is DECENT for such a cheap pair of headphones. I'm a bit of an audiophile and will often return headphones if they don't sound good (and trust me, a lot in this price range and even more expensive don't sound great). Sure they don't sound as good as my $300 headphones, but for normal/everyday use while working, they're good enough.
- They look fantastic.
- The inline mic is decent (I'm able to have conference calls with it no problem and people hear me fine).

Cons:
- The ear pads are a bit TOO soft and compress a lot, causing some discomfort during longer listening sessions, probably due to the plastic behind them. Maybe they got worse with time, too.
- They *feel* flimsy (BUT they haven't shown any signs of weakness or breakage yet).

I'd definitely buy them again.
Die Kopfhörer haben für das Preissegment einen sehr guten Klang für meine Zwecke. Verarbeitung und Qualität sind völlig in Ordnung. Die BT-Verbindung steht stabil.
Sound is amazing but roo small for me

item64.name: Joysico Wired Over The Ear Earbuds with Microphone Volume Control Ear Hook and Case, Sweatproof Sport Earphones for Running Exercise Gym Workout, Wrap Around Headphones for Cellphones, Laptop, Tablet
item64.description:
STAY PUT IN EARS SPORT EARBUDS - The over earhook works with different ear shapes and keep the ear buds stay in place even when getting sweaty. You don't have to jam the ear bud deep in the ear to avoid falling out and no need to constantly adjust the earbuds. A shirt clip is included to help stabilize the set and avoid cable getting in the way while doing different exercises. A great music listening set for running, jogging, hiking and gym workouts.
COMFORTABLE FOR PROLONGED USE - With soft over-ear hook and lightweight design, these wrap around earbuds are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. You will hardly feel them even when wearing glasses. You can choose the optimum fit for your ears with 6 pairs different sizes of silicone and foam eartips. Suitable for prolonged use for listening to music, audiobooks, podcasts and long calls. The 52in/130cm cord allow earbuds easily plug into the treadmill without feeling constricted.
CLEAR BALANCED SOUND AND GOOD NOISE ISOLATION - Built with 13mm drivers, these workout earbuds produce crisp clear and well-balanced stereo sound with good bass, emphasis on mids and highs. In ear design helps block out enough ambient noise to keep you focused on your workout. Multiple options of ear pieces enhance the audio experience and isolation performance. You can hear phone calls, music or movies clearly at a comfortable volume level at noisy gym, during subway commute and flight travel.
CLEAR MIC AND VOLUME CONTROL - Noise cancelling microphone picks up your voice clearly without backgroud noises. A good wired solution for phone calls, zoom meetings, VOIP calls, discord, etc. The inline control buttons allow you to easily answer/end calls, pause/play/skip tracks, control volume and activate voice assistant. You can take crystal clear calls hands-free and have full control without reaching out to your phone, whether at work, in a run, gyming or walking on the streets.
DURABLE AND SWEATPROOF - These sports headphones are built to last, with thick and sturdy cable, reinforced plug and sweatproof. Come with a hard carrying case for easy portability and protecting earbuds while not in use. Compatible with iphone, ipad, ipod, Macbook, MP3, tablet, laptop, chromebook, computer, Android/Windows cell phones, kindle, radio, PS4, PS5, airplane tv and others with 3.5mm audio jack (need ligtning adapter to work with iphone 7 and above version). 1 year warranty provided.
reviews: These earbuds not only provide great sound, they are actually comfortable. My ears don't hurt after wearing them for an hour or two. I had never heard of them before but decided to give it a try and I'm a very happy customer.
not very comfortable ,maybe I just need to get used to them. great sound for my talking books though. good price.

I use these to listen to TV and also my iPod when I walk each day. I previously had three sets of Sony earphones similar to these. The Sonys were $30 each and within 1-2 years I would have to replace them because one of the wires would break internally. Joysico seems to be a better product in my opinion....and WOW! less than half the price of Sony. I've only used the Joysicos for two days now......

I bought these for a painting job. I get into all different kinds of positions and these stay put on my head and firmly in my ears. The sound cannot compare to over the ear headphones but they are ideal for this kind of job. They are very good at blocking out the sound of the sanders I am using.

I needed a set of plug in head phones for my riding lessons and clinics. Most earbuds would not stay in my ears and I would end up having to stop to adjust them. After reading reviews from runners that use these, I bought them. These stay in place throughout my riding lesson without having to make any adjustments. Very pleased with this purchase.

At first I didn't think I'd like the way the headset hooks over the ear going from the front to the back; however, it works nicely and I don't notice any difference. If you look closely at the photos of this headset, you will see that the ear piece is attached to a small arm-like thing. Thus, you don't need to ram the actual hearing bud into your ear, it sits there nicely. Very satisfied with this headset.
Lasted 6 weeks before the right earbud broke off the ear set and the wires separated from microphone
These are great ear buds! Clear quality. Only downfall was that after awhile of wearing them they did make my ear’s hurt a little bit.
item64.detail:
Joysico Wired Over The Ear Earbuds with Microphone Volume Control Ear Hook and Case, Sweatproof Sport Earphones for Running Exercise Gym Workout, Wrap Around Headphones for Cellphones, Laptop, Tablet STAY PUT IN EARS SPORT EARBUDS - The over earhook works with different ear shapes and keep the ear buds stay in place even when getting sweaty. You don't have to jam the ear bud deep in the ear to avoid falling out and no need to constantly adjust the earbuds. A shirt clip is included to help stabilize the set and avoid cable getting in the way while doing different exercises. A great music listening set for running, jogging, hiking and gym workouts.
COMFORTABLE FOR PROLONGED USE - With soft over-ear hook and lightweight design, these wrap around earbuds are comfortable to wear for long periods of time. You will hardly feel them even when wearing glasses. You can choose the optimum fit for your ears with 6 pairs different sizes of silicone and foam eartips. Suitable for prolonged use for listening to music, audiobooks, podcasts and long calls. The 52in/130cm cord allow earbuds easily plug into the treadmill without feeling constricted.
CLEAR BALANCED SOUND AND GOOD NOISE ISOLATION - Built with 13mm drivers, these workout earbuds produce crisp clear and well-balanced stereo sound with good bass, emphasis on mids and highs. In ear design helps block out enough ambient noise to keep you focused on your workout. Multiple options of ear pieces enhance the audio experience and isolation performance. You can hear phone calls, music or movies clearly at a comfortable volume level at noisy gym, during subway commute and flight travel.
CLEAR MIC AND VOLUME CONTROL - Noise cancelling microphone picks up your voice clearly without backgroud noises. A good wired solution for phone calls, zoom meetings, VOIP calls, discord, etc. The inline control buttons allow you to easily answer/end calls, pause/play/skip tracks, control volume and activate voice assistant. You can take crystal clear calls hands-free and have full control without reaching out to your phone, whether at work, in a run, gyming or walking on the streets.
DURABLE AND SWEATPROOF - These sports headphones are built to last, with thick and sturdy cable, reinforced plug and sweatproof. Come with a hard carrying case for easy portability and protecting earbuds while not in use. Compatible with iphone, ipad, ipod, Macbook, MP3, tablet, laptop, chromebook, computer, Android/Windows cell phones, kindle, radio, PS4, PS5, airplane tv and others with 3.5mm audio jack (need ligtning adapter to work with iphone 7 and above version). 1 year warranty provided.

item65.name: Belkin SoundForm Inspire Wireless Over-Ear Headset for Kids, Headphones for Girls and Boys, Online Learning, & Travel with Built-In Microphone-Compatible with iPhone, iPad, Galaxy, and More - Lavender
item65.description:
BLUETOOTH CONNECTIVITY: Kids can easily connect to iPhone, iPad, Galaxy, and other devices with Bluetooth 5.2 pairing. Enjoy 35 hours of playtime when fully charged and maintain your connection from up to 30 feet away.
FLIP-UP MICROPHONE: The adjustable boom mic provides clear call quality as kids speak to their parents, teachers, and friends. Plus, an LED light on the microphone lets them easily indicate when their over-the-ear headset is on mute.
SAFE SOUND FOR KIDS: Designed with Belkin Signature Sound with audio tuned specifically for kids, this headphone set has an 85dB volume limiter to protect kids' hearing. And high-fidelity sound is never compromised with 40mm drivers.
CONVENIENT & COMFORTABLE: SoundForm Inspire is cleverly crafted for a wide range of children, made foldable and extandable with a comfortable over-the-ear design. These headphones also have a built-in USB-C port for fast charging and wired audio input.
STYLISH & FUNCTIONAL: A 3.5mm audio jack allows for wired audio, and kids can enjoy RockStar Mode with a second 3.5mm output for audio sharing with a friend or classmate. Bulk is also minimized, so your child gets the perfect fit with a hint of style.
reviews:
These Belkin bluetooth headphones are *fantastic* for the price (under $30). Amazon shows a number of critical reviews dragging down the review score for these based on pairing/connectivity issues, but like many older bluetooth devices, this can be very device-dependent with newer phones/tablets being more reliable.

I'm glad I gave these a shot since I personally had no issues pairing the Belkin headphones with my Google Pixel 6. I paired them once and now the Belkin headphones connect immediately when turned on and disconnect immediately when turned off. I have multiple other bluetooth headphones and speakers paired with my phone, and they each connect perfectly to my phone when turned on (although I never turn on more than one headphone/speaker at the same time).

These Belkin headphones fit great on my 6 year old daughter at the smallest setting. The headband has plenty of adjustment to the point where they could even stretch to fit my adult head, so they should continue to fit her well for years to come. One thing to note is that if you have larger teens, the thinner plastic in the headband becomes unsheathed when extended and I could see that being less durable. But at the smallest setting, these feel pretty sturdy, especially in light of how affordable they are.

Sound quality and battery life are both more than acceptable for the price point and intended use for kids. My daughter thinks they are clear sounding and told me several times she appreciates how she can better hear the words in her favorite songs. She uses the headphones mostly for longer car rides, so I haven't been able to confirm whether it achieves the quoted battery life, but it is plenty long enough for our needs.

Last thing to note: I suspect that the listening protection/maximum volume of 85 dB is for bluetooth only. I wanted to buy a bluetooth headphone that also can connect via wired since my daughter can use it when playing our keyboard/digital piano. However, when plugged in to our keyboard at full volume, these Belkin headphones get noticeably louder than they do over bluetooth. So if you're going to have your kids use these wired, consider supervising or monitoring the volume to avoid hearing damage!

Bought these for traveling by with my 18month old. So far we have used them several times. Sound quality is pretty good for the price, they are lightweight and comfortable. Connectivity is good, easy to pair. Not sure about battery life as we have only used them for a few minutes at a time but they feel sturdy even though they are not heavy. I am very pleased with these as travel headphones for my girl so far.

My kod is 1.5yrs old and this fits great at the smallest setting. Being his first headphones we didn't want to drop $100 on a pair. The $20 JLabs looked like it would be too big so we opted for these Belkins. The sound quality is as expected for the price range. When maxed out it didn't seem as loud as standard headphones. I could barely hear them at listening volume when they were sitting on the coffee table.

On the first go, the tike kept them on for over 5 minutes. Whether it was the allure of Vivo or not, it was comfortable enough to not be bothered. He has since gotten more used to it. Hopefully, 2 months is long enough for him to enjoy having them on or else that 5hr flight is gonna be rough...

Pairing them is very simple. I do not like how you cannot enter a pairing mode with a long press. Regardless of device, it needs to be unpaired before you can pair it to another device.

Can't speak on the battery life too much since the kid hasn't used it enough to warrant a recharge. That being said, he's used it for at least 1 hr - longer if you include standby mode.

These headphones deliver good sound quality, pack a flexible microphone, provide protection from high volume levels, can be both wired-or-Bluetooth, and if that's not enough, they have a 3.5mm out for sharing. I bought this for a child but at this price point, I could try these for myself! Excellent design at a good price point.

Good wireless headphones that fit both my 3 and 5 year old. I took them on multiple airplane trips and they lasted the whole flight without needing a charge. They're durable and work well but I do not believe they're noise cancelling. I didn't buy them for noise cancelling though so it wasn't something I was bothered by.
I bought these for my kids to take to school with them. They have lasted the full school year with no issues at all. They are also a great price point and comfortable.

My daughter loves listening to music and this headset was always present every time we travel! It connects with the Bluetooth quickly, and the sound is great! She said it’s pretty lightweight and fits her bag’s front pocket too when folded. She rarely charge it and would always keep the charge for long hours!
Comfortable on the ear and made of good material. Looks good so far. Also connects easily via bluetooth.
best headphones for kids. i got one before but unfortunately my kid break that. but he love this soo much that i bought the same one again.
Fit kids head well. Sound is clear and battery life is sufficient.

So I am a fully grown adult with the ear canal size of a small child. I have searched high and low for tips that fit because literally every other earphone I've tried would fall out, and I came across these and bought them because they had tiny size earbuds so I gave it a shot. The xxs fit perfectly in my ears (embarrassing) so I'm really really happy about that. HOWEVER... the mic sucks. I bought these pretty much solely for talking on the phone and apparently I sound muffled and as if I'm underwater. Sound quality on my end is great, music sounds great and clear, touch controls are easy. But if you are buying these to talk on the phone, don't bother. Only music? Get it. Need tiny tips? Absolutely, but find another brand of earphones to use the tips on. 3 stars for sound quality on my end and tiny tips.

Got for my kid for Christmas, one earbud totally stopped working last week. Save your money, time and the aggravation of a kid who is upset and frustrated, especially after they worked hard at making sure they took care of their belongings only to have the company fail them. Belkin - please do better. People work hard for their money.
Build feels pretty flimsy for fifty bucks. I assumed it would be USB-C but it's the older mini usb, which sucks. Sound quality is not terrible but again, for the price I expected better.

item66.name: Skullcandy Crusher Evo Over-Ear Wireless Headphones Bundle with Protective Case and USB-C Cable - Skullcandy Headphones Wireless Bluetooth with Adjustable Haptic Sensory Bass, 40 Hr Battery (Black)
item66.description:
SKULLCANDY WIRELESS HEADPHONES BUNDLE. Includes 1 x pair of Skullcandy Crusher Evo Headphones, 1 x Protective Case, and 1 x USB-C to C cable. Whether you're looking for the best gym headphones or better in-flight distraction, enjoy Crusher Bass headphones with immersive audio.
FEEL THE BASS TUNED TO YOU. Skullcandy Evo overear headphones are more than simple bass boosted headphones. Get ready to experience the patented, skull-thumping power of Crusher Bass — now combined with the ultimate audio customization of Personal Sound technology.
CRUSHER BASS: NOTHING COMPARES. Crusher Evo Skullcandy headphones are the original, one-and-only immersive sensory bass experience. Turn the slider down for mellower bass. Turn it up to really rattle your bones and experience an even broader range of deeper, richer low-end.
SOUND OPTIMIZED FOR YOU. Tune for your hearing with the app. No one's hearing is the same... That's why these Skull candy headphones feature Personal Sound with Audiodo technology that analyzes the hearing in your left and right ear, then automatically adjusts the audio.
A BIG, FAT 40 HOURS OF BATTERY LIFE. You don’t have time to plug in your headphones every time you turn around. That’s why Crusher Evo is engineered with a full 40 hours of battery life. Plus, whenever you get low, the Rapid Charge feature gives you an extra 4 hours of listening time from just a quick, 10-minute charge.
reviews:
This is a review of the Skullcandy Crusher Evo Over-Ear Wireless Headphones.

I listen to music and audiobooks a lot so I am always eager to try out new headphones. I am happy to say that I really like these a lot.

On the plus side, these come well-packaged with good, easy-to-follow instructions. It’s very easy to pair with my Kindle and my tablet and cell phones. They are also easy to store in a protective zippered case and they charge up quickly with different charging cables. They hold a charge for a long time.

What makes these extra-nice is the sound quality - it is rich and immersive. I often have an issue with the quality of the bass but not with these; there is a simple sliding bass adjuster with which you can control the bass but even pulled all the way down they sounded great. I have attached some photos which show you the sliding adjuster and know it’s easy to reach all the controls with your hands while the headphones are on.

The only critique I have is that I found the headphones to be a little uncomfortable if worn for any length of time. My husband did not have this issue with these and he has declared that these headphones are for him.

Recommended with the one issue above.

I haven't gotten to use these much but the little time I have I am in love with them. Most buy them for the ability to increase the bass but for me it was the opposite! I had a pair years ago that you could adjust the bass on and they helped tremendously with the headaches I get from the bass, so far since I can turn the bass all the way down on the earphone it is helping too. They connected easily to my laptop the first time and every time I have used them. As I said I have the bass turned all the way down so I cannot comment on that but otherwise the sound quality is great!

The Crushers are a meme. They have been for years and I did try the originals and they were pretty terrible. I saw these pop up and decided to give them a shot.

The Bluetooth connection seems great and I've had zero dropouts but there is also a pretty hefty amount of latency, definitely more than enough to ruin lip sync. The wired connection is much better, but I am also plugging it into a ~$20k audio chain so it's kind of being carried by that but even being wired at all totally eliminates the latency so it's a win in my books.

Isolation is actually quite poor for a closed back. It really doesn't block out much outside noise at all, but it's not that bad when actually listening to things and conversely, it leaks a LOT of noise to the people around you like a semi-open set.

Comfort is honestly great, but I do wish that there was more space inside the cups, my ears basically touch the pads all the way around.

The sound quality overall is about average, and tuning is fairly neutral with what seems to be a bit of rolled off treble so detail does suffer quite a bit, but using the AutoEQ (everyone has free access to EQ whether it be on PC or mobile and if you own these and aren't using it, you wasted your money) preset for the Crusher Evo does make them DRASTICALLY more capable. The haptic bass is hilarious. It's fun, but it is also basically pointless above around 10% of the slider, any more than that and it just exclusively takes away from all performance and sound quality. Is it funny to crank it to max and listen to bassy tracks or action movies? Yes. Does it sound good or add anything positive? Absolutely not. That being said, the tactile feel of having it around 5-10% is actually pretty cool and I do like it.

In stock form without EQ and with the Bluetooth latency taken into consideration, these are a firm 3 star. With EQ and hard wired, I'd put them closer to 4 stars. Price wise, these are a $100 headphone and the listing I got them from had them at a $199.99 price and is now at $179.99 and at that price, these are a total joke and in no way worth that asking price. They aren't worth a single cent over $100 and in my opinion should be closer to $75 solely because of the fairly unique haptic bass. If Skullcandy could tone down the haptic bass to a more usable range and cap out around 15% of the total but retain the whole sweep for finer adjustment and get the stock tuning in line with something closer to Harman (again, EQ is free and can accomplish this), these would be a great buy at $100 for someone wanting something fun and engaging. The Bluetooth latency is probably a thing of the past seeing as that these are a few years old and Bluetooth codecs nowadays are much better so the newer models most likely don't suffer from this nearly as much, but I can't say for sure. Overall decent product just a bit overpriced and needs some help to perform where they should.

The sound quality is great with everything coming through clearly, the bass was fantastic. One thing that effects the sound quality is the positioning of the headphones because they do not fully envelope the ears and may press on and block some of the ears. This also effects the noise canceling a little. Because they are on ear a little they can get a little uncomfortable over time but expect this will vary depending on the person and the size of their head and ears. As with any headphones the controls take a little getting used to and these are the same. Don't have a good idea about the battery life yet, will update when I do. Really like the looks and build of these.

In my experience Skullcandy always delivers. This headset is easy to use, easy to take with you and the case keeps is safe when you’re not using it. It has good battery life and charges fast. I love that you can easily control the bass level. These aren’t as awesome at noise cancelation as my AirPod Max headphones, and they don’t have quite the same sound quality, but I don’t like to travel with those, because they are so expensive. These Skullcandy headphones are affordable, have great sound and travel well. They are also great for keeping in your bag, so you always have a pair of headphones with you.

Still not better than AirPods, but given its price and branding for skull candy, it’s a pretty mid range basic headset that could last you a while. Probably the best for vacations if you don’t want to worry about losing expensive or valuable items
Exactly as described I love the sound quality it comes with everything you need

item67.name: PSIER Open Ear Headphones, Bluetooth 5.3 Wireless Sports Headphones with Digital Display Charging Case 40 Hours Playtime True Earbuds with Earhooks for Running, Walking, Workout
item67.description:
True Open Ear Headphones: PSIER headphones adopt a completely open design, the earbuds can be gently and firmly placed on the top of the ear. Open ear earbuds are typically lighter and more breathable than in-ear headphones, making them more comfortable to wear for extended periods of time.
Be Aware of Surrounding: Since open ear headphones don't go into your ears, they can make you more aware of your surroundings. When you listen to music while running or cycling outdoors, you can still hear approaching cars or other potential hazards and go through the day with safety.
40H Playtime & Digital Display: On single fully charge, bluetooth headphones last up to 20 hours, and the charging case can charge the earbuds an additional time, so you can get 40 hours of total playtime from a fully charged case. In addition, the smart LED Power Display in the case shows the remaining battery in real-time, which lets you know if the charging case or running headset needs to be charged or not. Don’t have to worry about any power issue.
Powerful Stereo Sound : Equipped with 16.2 millimeters vibrating diaphragm speaker drivers that are 3 times larger than other wireless earbuds, headphones provide pure balanced audio and clarity output for all music genres. Crystal clear, deep, resonant bass, finely tuned sound signature delivers immersive sound that puts you on the center stage.
Latest Bluetooth 5.3 Technology: Bluetooth earbuds feature the latest Bluetooth 5.3 technology, ensuring a fast and stable connection. You can enjoy a low-latency listening experience with audio and video perfectly synced without any delay.
reviews:
I recently purchased the PSIER Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth Headphones, and I must say that they have exceeded my expectations in every way. These earbuds have truly revolutionized my audio experience, providing exceptional performance and unmatched convenience.

First and foremost, the sound quality delivered by these earbuds is outstanding. The audio is crisp, clear, and immersive, allowing me to fully enjoy my favorite music, podcasts, and movies. The bass response is impressive, adding depth and richness to the overall listening experience. Whether I'm in the gym, commuting, or simply relaxing at home, the PSIER Wireless Earbuds deliver an audio experience that is second to none.

The wireless functionality of these earbuds is a game-changer. The Bluetooth connectivity is seamless and reliable, ensuring a stable connection with my devices. I no longer have to deal with tangled wires or limited mobility. The freedom to move around without any restrictions is truly liberating. Additionally, the earbuds come with a compact charging case that provides extended battery life, allowing me to enjoy my music for hours on end without worrying about running out of power.

Comfort is another area where the PSIER Wireless Earbuds excel. The ergonomic design and multiple ear tip options ensure a secure and comfortable fit, even during extended use. They stay in place, providing a snug fit that effectively blocks out external noise, allowing me to fully immerse myself in my audio content.

The build quality of these earbuds is exceptional. They feel sturdy and well-made, giving me confidence in their durability. The sleek and stylish design is an added bonus, making them a fashionable accessory that complements any outfit.

Lastly, the customer service provided by PSIER has been outstanding. They have been responsive and helpful, addressing any queries or concerns promptly. Their commitment to customer satisfaction is truly commendable.

In conclusion, I wholeheartedly recommend the PSIER Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth Headphones to anyone in search of a top-notch audio experience. With their exceptional sound quality, wireless convenience, comfortable fit, and impressive build quality, these earbuds have become an indispensable part of my daily routine. Invest in the PSIER Wireless Earbuds and elevate your audio experience to new heights.

Review by Ron McFarland
I recently purchased the "Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth Earbuds Built..." from Amazon, and I must say, these earbuds have far exceeded my expectations. From the moment I opened the package, I knew I was in for a treat.
First and foremost, the sound quality of these wireless earbuds is exceptional. The audio is crisp, clear, and delivers a rich, immersive experience. Whether I'm listening to my favorite music, watching movies, or taking calls, the sound reproduction is flawless. The bass is deep and satisfying, and the overall balance of the audio spectrum is impressive.

The Bluetooth connectivity is seamless, allowing for a hassle-free pairing process. I appreciate the stable connection these earbuds provide, as I can freely move around without worrying about signal drops. The range is also commendable, as I can keep my device in one room while I wander around the house, enjoying uninterrupted audio.

Comfort-wise, these earbuds truly shine. The ergonomic design fits perfectly in my ears, providing a snug and secure fit. I can wear them for extended periods without any discomfort or ear fatigue. Additionally, the lightweight construction adds to the overall comfort, making them ideal for workouts, commuting, or simply relaxing at home.

The battery life on these earbuds is impressive as well. I can go for hours without needing to recharge, which is a huge convenience. The charging case is compact and easy to carry, providing additional charging on the go. It's great to have peace of mind knowing that I won't run out of power during my daily activities.

Furthermore, the built-in microphone delivers crystal-clear call quality. I have had numerous conversations using these earbuds, and the voice clarity on both ends is exceptional. The noise-canceling feature ensures that my voice comes through loud and clear, even in noisy environments.

In terms of build quality, these earbuds feel premium and durable. The materials used are of high quality, and they have held up well to daily use. The touch controls are intuitive and responsive, allowing me to easily adjust volume, skip tracks, or answer calls with a simple tap.

Overall, the "Wireless Earbuds Bluetooth Earbuds Built..." have impressed me in every aspect. They offer outstanding sound quality, reliable connectivity, remarkable comfort, and impressive battery life. I highly recommend these earbuds to anyone in search of an excellent and exceptional audio experience.

These wireless earbuds are a great value for the price. They have a long battery life, good sound quality, and are comfortable to wear. I especially like the noise cancellation feature, which is great for making calls or listening to music in noisy environments.

The only downside is that the touch controls can be a little tricky to use at first. But once you get used to them, they're very convenient.

Overall, I'm very happy with these earbuds and would definitely recommend them to others.

Here are some of the things I like most about these earbuds:

Long battery life: I can easily get 7-8 hours of use on a single charge.
Good sound quality: The sound is clear and balanced, with good bass and treble response.
Comfortable to wear: The earbuds are lightweight and fit snugly in my ears.
Noise cancellation: The noise cancellation feature is very effective at reducing background noise.

item68.name: Sony DJ Headphones 4334205465, Black, Standard
item68.description:
40mm Neodymium Drivers, Closed Design
Swiveling Ear cups, Single-Sided Cable
Closed-ear design provides comfort and outstanding reduction of external noises
9.8-foot cord ends in gold-plated plug and it is not detachable; 1/4-inch adapter included
These large diaphragm, foldable headphones feature a rugged construction, a secure, highly effective closed-ear design
reviews: I love my Samsung Galaxy Buds2 Pro but there are times where my ears need a break from them for comfort. I wanted corded headphones specifically beacause of not wanting to lose tethering and to have natural sound. The Sonys are amazing and has better sound dynamics than the Bud2 Pro. I know I'm comparing apples and oranges. I was going to return them based on the coil cord and using them primarily with my phone, but I changed my mind and will keep them. Why? For the pricing and quality you can't go wrong with these especially the sound quality!!

These are NOT noise cancelling, so don't make that mistake. They do, however, have great sound quality and are quite comfortable. I love using them for video calls at work because it's actually better when you can hear your own voice a little (I gather that's why podcasters seem to all use these exact headphones). I also love how long the chord is.

Youll be tempted to check that your loudspeakers are off. Delivers a full bodied sonic experience. like a thatre sound system. Movies will seem to be alive. Concerts will deliver every instrument to your ears Stereo imaging is perfect.

Worth the price! Of course Sony always is. I love these.

I could have saved a lot of money I wasted on other head phones which were made of inferior plastic, and broke apart in a couple of months.

Super headphones! This pair of Sony MDR-7506 Headphones has extra long "curly cords". I wish they were straight cords, which would not tangle with my other cables, and weigh so heavily on the headphones as to pull them off my head. All else, the comfort, and the frequency response, not boosted in the bass and not rolled-off for the C-8 on a piano, makes them ideal for Studio work. With equally well performing mikes, they combine perfectly for piano vocals, so that the vocalist knows that others hearing a audition or studio recording will not hear breathing, or false bass, but what the singer hears in the Studio room acoustics. Excellent headphones. My second pair. My first pair, I clipped-off the curly cords and put on a Gold-plated stereo connector. Cheers!

2nd pair of these. Tried another wireless pair as a cheaper alternate to these, only to return to these. I prefer the wired option given there are so many other BT devices that want to pair with BT headphones.

item69.description:
【 High Quality Sound Quality 】 Wireless headphones are equipped with a 40mm (1.6 inch) large coverage composite diaphragm pronunciation unit, with titanium coated composite diaphragm and LDAC codec, supporting LDAC decoding and high resolution, providing you with immersive sound with high fidelity audio and wireless authentication of high fidelity audio.
【 -43dB Hybrid Active Noise Cancellation 】 The wireless noise canceling headphone can achieve a depth of -43 ANC through hybrid ANC technology and closed design. The headphones will automatically recognize environmental noise and transmit corrected signals, allowing you to enjoy quiet music time during commuting, work, home, or travel.
【 Extra long usage time 】 Over ear noise canceling headphones can provide up to 49 hours of playback time when fully charged, meeting your ultra long usage needs. At the same time, it adopts fast charging technology, which can provide 7 hours of uninterrupted usage time after 10 minutes of charging.
【Wearing without pressure】 The new improved W820NB Plus headset uses memory foam cushioning material with patent technology of zero pressure sense. The weight of the headset is only 7.9 ounces (220g). Even wearing glasses can bring you a super comfortable wearing experience.
【 Personalized EQ Control 】 Connect your W820NB Plus earphones to the Edifier Connect application for additional features. With personalized EQ, shutdown timer, power display, prompt volume, and soothing sound options, you will definitely fall in love with music.
reviews:
Sound quality is awesome(I have several high-end headphones but needed one for the gym to block the loud music they have).
This fits the bill! HIGHLY recommended.
Overall, they are good! Sound quality could be better. Compared to my old headphones, they seem to be lacking a little bass, but they are not bad. Just fine for the $$$$$!
It's lighter than my last headphone and more fitting.

I LIVE in noise-canceling headphones. I don't enjoy hearing people yell from room to room or have belching contests or get mad at the news. Headphones are perfect and don't cramp anyone's style or life. So my last (pricey) pair had been taped together so many times it was time for new ones. I started to get the 3rd set of the kind I'd had for years (about $250), because they're great, but I took a chance on a cheaper pair. I didn't hear the garage door opener, twice, in the room right over it. I didn't hear anyone yelling for my attention 4 feet away. And the sound quality is excellent. I can't believe how much better these work for 20% of the cost!
I wanted noise cancelling headphones that weren’t going to break the bank. I spent a more of time reading reviews and went with these. They have been wonderful and I’m very pleased with my purchase.
the noise cancellation feature is actually way nicer than i expected it to be, i love these headphones i can’t walk to class without them!
Quick and simple to pair. Noise cancellation is fantastic
Sound is great very comfortable

La caja hermosa. Honestamente al abrirlo se ven muy plásticos y simples. Aunque eso es bueno ya que son ultra ligeros y por fin mis orejas se mueven adentro. Curiosamente en Bluetooth básico con un ecualizador que suba potencia es mejor que con cables, OJO SONIDO audiófilo y le falta potencia si eres basshead no creo, es más para viajeros de aeropuerto, camión o el metro . Su fuerte es lo ligero y la bateria que presume de 36 horas con ANC que cancela un 50% ruido no hace milagros. LA CANCELACIÓN DE RUIDO ES SUTIL no es su mejor característica pero el sello que hace y su ligereza es lo mejor además del LDAC en ANDROID es supremo por la calidad que parece con cable... El modo ambiente suena mejor, si lo registras ganas un modo. Dos toques MODO JUEGO con poca latencia o LAG para juegos exactos o películas... Los uso con un Motorola con DOLBY ATMOS y mejora. Modo ambiente filtra con su microfono algo del audio afuera por si requerís oir algo y no aislarte, un boton y te asila ANC con la música sin hacer milagros ojo NO ES UN TAPÓN . Perfecto para el aeropuerto o oir a alguien que te grita. Si activas el ANC cancelación si genera una onda SUTIL Y LIGERA no esperen milagro BOSE... pero suficiente para el METRO O UN CAMIÓN O UN VENCINO RUIDOSO INCLUSO PARA EN SILENCIO MEDITAR SIEMPRE Y CUANDO HAYA SILENCIO ACABA CON EL RUIDO DEL VIENTO DIGAMOS Y COCHES LIGEROS CAMINANDO, EL MICROFONO ES REGULAR Y CONECTADO EN USB MEJORA MUCHO... ES COMO PONERTE TAPONES DE GOMA BARATOS Y SELLAR LOS OIDOS... no es la gran cosa su ANC. Vale mucho por su pila, por la distancia literal traspasa muros, por el LDAC en android pero en windows 11 no se puede sigo investigando como sacar el LDAC en IPHONE, ahi no recomiendo sólo ANDROID. Gran producto. ligero, suficiente CALIDAD AUDIOFILA LIGERA, y lo compre a 15 meses donde pagaré menos de 5 dólares al mes por muchos meses... así si lo vale... si quieren BASS vayan a un CRUSHER o incluso gamers o un CHIFI KZ si quieren ruido loco y potencia incluso sony mejora BASS en sus TWS... este es un audiofilo ligero rendidor de pila y movilidad mas que potencia de plástico... recuerden EQUALIZAR un FX APP recomiendo o les faltara potencia al principio.

item70.description:
🎶 Superior Sound with aptX Technology: With HROEENOI's headphones, experience music like never before. Powered by aptX audio codec, enjoy wireless sound that's rich, clear, and feels like you're listening live. From treble up to 20kHz to immersive bass, every note is reproduced in detail.
🔇 Ultimate Noise Cancellation: Drift into your music world, uninterrupted. Our advanced ANC technology silences distractions, making it perfect for noisy commutes, busy offices, or travel. Hear what you want, not what's around you.
🔋 Always Ready to Play: Enjoy up to 40 hours of playtime in ANC mode. And with our quick charge feature, a brief 10-minute charge gets you up to 4 hours of playback. Your music keeps up with your pace, day and night.
🎧 Comfort Meets Versatility: Designed for all-day wear, our lightweight and adjustable headphones fit everyone – from adults to kids. Whether you're working, traveling, or heading to the gym, HROEENOI becomes an essential part of your lifestyle.
🌍 Stellar Support & Commitment: We value your satisfaction above all. If you have questions or issues, our dedicated customer support is just a message away. Plus, our headphones are an excellent gift choice, letting you share the magic of music with loved ones.
reviews: I’ve thought I’ve broken these so many times, I shove em In my bag, I’ve dropped them, I’ve sat on them-they haven’t broken. Beyond that they still sound as good as they did when I bought them sometime in 2022. I use these in the gym, at work, at school and the noise cancellation alone is great. I will say it’s not completely noise cancelling when there is no music but honestly as a woman I greatly appreciate that, not being able to hear on a walk or run sometimes can be a little dangerous when you are used to somewhat relying on hearing the world around you for safety. The battery also lasts really long, I charge these probably once a week and just to put that into perspective for some people I’m in the top 5% of Spotify users, I’m alwaysssssss listening to something with these. The ear pieces rotate and fold in which is nice for when you put them in a bag or something which it does come with a pretty nice pouch, I do with it was a hard shell pouch just for a little more safety but like I said they should’ve broken so many times and they just simply haven’t so I kind of understand. I also think it was cute that it came with a pink charger and aux cord that’s a nice touch Fr. If the bag woulda been pink too??? Ooooo extra extra credit dawg. I really expected these to be okay but they are great especially for the price, these have held up better than a lot of my more expensive headphones in the past. The ear pads are also very comfortable not too soft but also not too hard and the music is louuuud like with these I can listen on 1/3 the volume I would on earbuds. I will say half volume or more the odds of innocent bystanders hearing your music is decently high. Anyways love these 10/10 recommend

I bought these about a year ago, and they work really well. Comfortable, good sound, long battery life, easy to use. But about a month ago part of the plastic on the headband broke, so when I'm wearing them, they don't stay in place very well. Even though I had no paperwork, figuring that most electronic items have a one year warranty, I contacted the seller and told them the problem. I included a copy of the invoice, and the replied very quickly that the warranty was still valid, and all they needed was my name and address and they could send me a replacement. I thought I would have to send the broken one back, but no. Less then two weeks later I received the replacement, and it works just like it's supposed to. So I'm very happy with both the headphones and the company.

I've been using these headphones for six weeks and my verdict is in: they're excellent. They really get the job done at a surprisingly low price. I bought them because my gym was driving me nuts. They blast the music way too loud, and while 99% of the people working out are wearing their own headphones. Why do they do it? I HAVE NO IDEA.

I listen to Audible novels in the gym. I can't stand ear buds, and my trusty old lightweight on-the-ear headphones let way too much noise in, even when I'd crank the volume all the way up, which made me worry about hearing damage. So I decided to try over-the-ear buckets with noise cancellation. I was skeptical that this model would be decent at such a low price, but I was wrong. Here's what I discovered:

Comfort: very comfortable. Even after 90 minutes I have no trace of head or ear fatigue. They're just plain comfy. And they're snug enough that they do not shift at all during my workouts.

Sound quality: I'm no expert but it seems perfect for music and audio books.

Noise cancellation: WOW! I'd never tried noise cancellation before and it's amazing. Put them on and click the noise cancellation button and suddenly it feels like a dome of silence was lowered around you. I kept turning off the button and partially removing the headphones just to verify the difference and wow, very cool. Almost all of the cacophony of the gym is greatly diminished -- all of the machines, banging weights, treadmills and everything seem to disappear. Same on an airplane. Same at my doctor's office waiting room when I sat next to some kind of noisy dehumidifier -- I pressed the button and the noise from the machine literally disappeared. Blew my mind.

The only problem and why I give it 4.5 stars instead of 5: In the gym, most of the background noise goes away, and same with the blasting music bass sounds and instruments, all gone -- however, the music VOCALS are still there. But they are reduced a decent amount. I'd say reduced from a 10 to a 5, whereas the other noises are reduced to a 2 or 1 or even zero. So I can still hear the vocals, but it's not distracting and my audio book is easily heard.

So given all that, this is a great product that I'd buy again. Very impressive!

UPDATE: after writing this review I wondered why the noise cancelling was not very effective with vocals. So I googled some articles and learned that even the most expensive noise cancelling headphones do not do well with reducing human speech, because it is at a frequency that is too high, whereas current noise cancelling technology is most effective at lower frequencies. Bottom line: it's a weakness with all models of noise cancelling headphones!

I’ve used these for maybe 5 months now and throughout my first semester of college. The battery lasts like 3-5 days sometimes more and that’s counting walking all around campus, using them in the gym, studying, etc. They are very noise cancelling especially with the AMC filter. Not too bulky but also big enough because I don’t like small headphones. They’re super cute and honestly amazing for only $50. Way better than spending 200+ on beats or AirPod maxes. They can feel a little tight sometimes when you wear them for too long but it’s never really been an issue for me. And I can use them when talking on the phone and people can hear me well. Definitely recommend.

Ordered this for a 14 hour drive at the start of the year and it is still extremely high quality and functioning. Don’t gota waist $100 of dollars on name brand really good noise canceling and buttons make it easy to adjust the audio

Easy to put on and off, fold-flat and light weight, speech optimized sound quality. Includes a clip for shirts or collars ensuring safe and secure use.
reviews: Great quality. Used when playing electronic drum set instead of a speaker
Pretty decent, however the sound quality isn’t top notch. But, you can’t really expect Bose quality at a bottom price. I’d say a solid 8 out of 10 though a good buy.

These headphones are very comfortable and have a great sound quality. The ears are very large and go completely around your ear, so this adds to the enhanced comfort. It also makes the sound better, as it achieves the 8D effect. The size is adjustable, although the smallest possible size was too big for me. It also has a very long, extendable wire, which is very convenient when wanting to be far or moving around. Overall, these headphones are very good, as it has both enhanced sound and comfort.

The description is a bit misleading. None of the modern TVs support a 3.5 mm AUX jack. Yes, the seven-meter cable is a very positive aspect, but unfortunately, it's impossible to connect these headphones to any modern TV. That's why I gave the product four stars instead of five. Everything else is quite decent. Everything shown in the pictures and description matches reality. The stand and the 6.35 mm adapter are included. The sound quality is relatively good for this price range. The seven-meter cable is an addition to the headphone's main cable, so it doesn't cause inconvenience if you're close to the jack. You can simply disconnect it. One more thing to note, if you truly want to connect these headphones to your TV, you'll need to purchase an additional converter that will convert the optical audio output found in almost all TVs into an analog signal. This will require extra spending.
